Patient was given the second dose of Pfizer Covid 19 vaccine on 6/2/21 at 12:29pm and was asked to wait for 15 minutes to watch how the patient reacts with the vaccine. He didn't have any side effect on his first dose. After 3 minutes of getting the vaccine, his wife notified me that she needs assistance. He was sweating profusely and was about to lose consciousness. His wife and I kept saying his name to check his response. He could not response or was about to faint. His pulse is slow, and his face is red. Since there was other customers waiting for shots in the clinic, I asked the technician to ask for pharmacy manager assistance. He came in the clinic, and checked patient's pulse and blood pressure. The blood pressure was high (170/89). We checked his blood pressure again, and it was lower after couple minutes. Patient started to have consciousness and understand what we are talking. He told us that he always had the same reaction after getting his blood drawn. We asked him to sit down and was monitored by us in the clinic. After 30 minutes, he said that he was feeling fine without any problems and decided to leave. He can breathe ok and didn't have any adverse reactions such as swelling of throat and lip or hives. His wife and he didn't eat anything before getting the vaccine. I checked his blood pressure again, and it was 130/80. Will follow up on him this evening and tomorrow.
49 2021-06-01 itchy skin, rash with redness Client (received the COVID vaccine (Pfizer dose 2, lot # EW0187, expiration 6/28/2021) at 1800. At 1... Read more
Close
Client (received the COVID vaccine (Pfizer dose 2, lot # EW0187, expiration 6/28/2021) at 1800. At 1829, the client reported itching on his skin and in his throat. EMT, EMT #2, PHN, and RN responded at this time. The client was sitting comfortably in his chair, alert and oriented x4. The client's vital signs were as follows: heart rate 57, O2 97, respiratory rate 14, blood pressure 150/92. The client's skin was pink, warm, and dry. The client denied any shortness of breath or chest discomfort. The client was able to speak in full sentences and had no visible swelling on his face or tongue. The client declined Benadryl at this time. The client stated he has environmental allergies and has had an anaphylactic reaction to trees in the past. The client stated he has a medical history of anxiety, acid reflux, migraines, and hay fever; he takes antacids, sumatriptan, and allegra. The client stated that he took 1 allegra at 1816, but stated he didn't know the exact dosage and did not have the medication bottle with him. The client was able to speak in full sentences. At 1835, the client identified a small, red, erethematous area approximately 1 centimeter in length on the left medial area of his elbow, which he stated itched. He also stated his eyes were itching; neither eye or eyelid appeared red. The client stated his throat was dry and was offered and accepted water. The client declined Benadryl again at this time. The client was transferred to the zero gravity chair at this time, denied any dizziness during ambulation or transfer. At 1839 the client's vital signs were as follows: blood pressure 142/84, heart rate 74, O2 97%. The client stated "I had an itchy throat this morning" and said that he had a migraine that morning but did not remember if he had taken any medication for the migraine. At 1849, the client's vital signs were as follows: blood pressure 122/84, heart rate 73, respiratory rate 16, O2 99%. At 1853, the client stated "I feel less itchy." At 1900, the client initially requested Benadryl, but then refused both the medication and vital signs when offered. The client stated that his arm "still itched" but denied that it was getting worse. The client stated "I wanted a Benadryl for the road but now I think I'm going to wait." The client denied shortness of breath, chest tightness or pain, or any difficulty breathing. The client did not appear to be in any distress and had no swelling visible on his face or tongue. The client continued to chat with staff and spoke with a pleasant demeanor. Education provided by PHN, EMT, and RN regarding primary care follow up and when to seek medical care. At 1915, the client requested Benadryl and stated "I think my rash is growing." The client's vital signs at that time were as follows: blood pressure 138/92, heart rate 88, O2 99%, respiratory rate 12. At 1922, the client was given 50mg Benadryl orally. At 1927, the client stated "my wife is here, it's time for me to go." RN reiterated the importance of staying for a 30 minute observation time, but the client continued to leave the building. EMT accompanied the client outside, where he ambulated with a steady gait. He walked to the outdoor observation area and then sat down, requesting to be evaluated by EMS. EMS was called by RN at 1933. The client was sitting comfortably and denied any shortness of breath or chest pain. EMS arrived on scene at 1936. At 1938, the client's vital signs were as follows: blood pressure 140/90, heart rate 60, and O2 100%. The client stated at that time that he "felt better" and declined transport to the hospital. The client signed AMA paperwork at 1945 and ambulated to his car with a steady gait, accompanied by his wife, who he stated was going to drive him to an urgent care.

Anaphylactic reaction; skin was on fire; sweating; stomach cramps; throwing up; his arms and saw they were solid red; inflamed; hands swelled up; itchy; sore; sore where injected the Testosterone into left arm.; sore where injected the Testosterone into left arm.; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). An 49-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm left on 11May2021 16:45 (Lot Number: EW0182; Expiration Date: 31Aug2021) as 1st 0.3 ml single dose at the age of 49-years-old for covid-19 immunisation; testosterone cipionate, via an unspecified route of administration from 2020 (Lot Number: 88945; Expiration Date: 30Sep2021) and ongoing, at 150 mg, 2x/week (150 mg injection bi weekly ) for gonads, low testosterone. The patient medical history included low testosterone, gastrooesophageal reflux disease, COVID in the past (He did not know initially he had it, he had lost of taste and smell). Concomitant medication included dexlansoprazole (DEXILANT) taken for gastrooesophageal reflux disease from an unspecified start date and ongoing. None prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks). No family medical history relevant to AEs. No additional vaccines administered on same date of the pfizer suspect. The patient experienced anaphylactic reaction (medically significant) on 17May2021. Time of onset (24-hour clock): Roughly 18:00. Usually he took the testosterone in the morning, but he forgot. He was wrapping up the day, took the testosterone and by 18:02 he was on the ground, cold. The patient got his vaccination last Tuesday (11May2021). He was also on testosterone for gonadism. He usually administered the vaccine in his shoulders. He took the testosterone bi-weekly. On Monday he administered it his left shoulder and on Thursday it is in his right shoulder. After getting the vaccine he administered testosterone in his right shoulder on Thursday and had no issues. The patient mentioned everyone else who got the COVID Vaccine he knows had sore arm, nausea, but he did not have any of that. On Monday (17May2021) he injected his testosterone into the same arm/location, left arm, where he got the COVID vaccine and had an anaphylactic reaction. He contacted his doctor and went to the emergency room. The patient confirmed he felt like he had recovered completely from the anaphylactic reaction. Caller clarified the anaphylactic reaction. He did the testosterone injection in the same spot he had the COVID injection. Within 5 minutes it was like his skin was on fire. He was sweating, had stomach cramps, and was throwing up. Once he stopped throwing up he looked at his arms and saw they were solid red. They were all inflamed. His legs were inflamed. His hands swelled up. They were red. He had to take his wedding ring off. He was itchy. It was like he was on fire. He was sore, and sore where injected the Testosterone into left arm. He confirmed he had no problems swallowing or breathing. Based on the symptoms he was experiencing he realized these were things listed to be aware of when getting the COVID shot and to seek medical attention for. He went to the ER and they verified it was an anaphylactic reaction. Treatment included: He was given an Epi-Pen. It made him feel like off, like he had too much coffee or something. he was also given Benadryl and some Anti-Inflammatory to calm his body down. Investigations: He had blood drawn at the ER. However, he does not know if was actually tested. He was informed when the nurse drew blood it would be up to the doctor, but he has no knowledge if anything was done. Action taken of testosterone cypionate was dose not changed. Outcome of the events was recovered on 17May2021.

hypotension; acute renal failure; fever; rigors; persistent rash; He had an IgG and PCR positive for EBV; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable pharmacist. A 49-years-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine), at the age of 49-years-old, via an unspecified route of administration on 23Apr2021 as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Pharmacist stated that a patient received the first dose of the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine on 23APR2021 and a week after he presented fever, rigors and persistent rash. He was the discharged and then presented acute renal failure and hypotension on 19May2021. He had an IgG and PCR positive for EBV. Pharmacist would like to know if there are reports of EBV (Epstein-Barr virus) reactivation. They have a patient who was admitted to the hospital and was wondering if Pfizer has any reports of reactivation of EBV after receiving the vaccine. She is not sure if it is related to the vaccine or not. The first hospital admission was because of continued fevers, rigors and rash. Patient received first dose on 23 Apr 2021, and then rash started on 29 Apr 2021. It is unknown when fever and rigors started. Patient was readmitted for same thing and is sicker. She then clarified that this admission was for hypotension with acute renal failure. The patient is now in ICU. The rash is still there and it is worse. The patient still has fevers. Reporter seriousness for Hypotension and acute renal failure: Hospitalization. Patient was in hospital for Hypotension and acute renal failure from 19 May 2021 to Ongoing. Event outcome of fever and rash was not recovered, the other events was unknown.; Sender's Comments: Based on the narrative information provided and the known drug safety profile, the reported events Pyrexia, Chills and Rash are considered as related to bnt162b2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine). A causal association between the reported events Hypotension and Acute kidney injury and bnt162b2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine) cannot be totally excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to RAs, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

He reports itching to his extremities. He has not noticed a rash. He denies syncope, nausea, vomiting, sore throat, congestion, chest pain, SOB, palpitations, weakness, slurred speech, abdominal pain, diarrhea. He denies history of prior allergic reactions. No new medications. he is not anxious. Denies rash likely related to vaccine administration at 1400; seen in the urgent care at 1600 and discharged after treatment and evaluation at 1858. Inventions: ekg no acute findings; methylPrednisonolone 125 mg IV; diphenhydramine 25 mg IV; famotidine 20mg po; odansetron 4mg IV home with Benadryl 25 mg Q6 hours for 5 days.

A 50-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), lot number: EK5730, intramuscular from 23Dec2020 11:00 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included patient's known allergies: Only grass, pollen, dust mites; and hives all from unspecified dates. Concomitant medication included naproxen sodium (ALEVE) for " itchy", ibuprofen (MOTRIN) and paracetamol (TYLENOL 8 HOUR). The patient got the COVID vaccine on 23Dec2020 at 11:00. He then started feeling itchy about 2 hours post vaccine. He took an Aleve. At home in the evening, took Benadryl with improvement of symptoms. The following day he also took Benadryl. On 25Dec2020 & 26Dec2020, he still had some itching, but not bothersome enough to take medications. On 27Dec2020 he was working cutting tile and wearing protective eye wear, but the dust that landed on his face caused hives. He has been taking Benadryl since. He said that this has occurred in the past when his body was hypersensitive, the hives. He has seasonal allergies but no allergies to food/medications/vaccines. Patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 and since the vaccination, he has not been tested for COVID-19.

On 1-26-2021, he presented to ED after waking up at 1AM with lip swelling and diffuse itchy rash. Rash involved both forearms, scalp, chest, abdomen, back, and legs. He took 50 mg of Benadryl at home, but woke up with worsened symptoms. Denied unusual foods, soaps, detergents, colognes, or medications. Patient denied shortness of breath, throat or intraoral swelling or pain, chest pain, palpitations, cough, sore throat, nasal congestion, rhinorrhea, fever, chills, loss of sense of taste or smell, abdominal pain, n/v, diarrhea or dysuria. Patient was treated with epinephrine 0.3 mg SQ, Solu-Medrol 125 mg, Benadryl 25 mg IV, and Pepcid 20 mg oral. Patient was re-evaluated an hour and a half after receiving medication and lipedema and urticarial improved. Patient was provided with an Rx for EpiPen kit, prednisone 40 mg daily for 3 days. He was told to follow up with his PCP.

50 2021-03-04 injection site pain About an hour after the shot, I felt some tingling in my face; that was followed by a few odd sensat... Read more
Close
About an hour after the shot, I felt some tingling in my face; that was followed by a few odd sensations, all of which are basically the same as when I have a flu shot. Eight hours after the shot, I noticed that I was smelling smoke; my sense of smell started to do weird things an hour before (for example, smelling rotten food in the fridge), but this became clear when the smoke smell started. Over the first 48 hours, my left arm was sore (sore to touch at 24 hours, gone at 48), and I had some mild flu symptoms (sore throat, stuffy nose, fatigue), plus some chest "tightness" which I have been feeling from time to time since March 2020. The flu-like symptoms were all basically gone except the stuffy nose. I still have a slight stuffy nose, and the strange smell issue. I have been able to smell things fine all along, it's just overlaid with a smell that started as smoke or BBQ, and varies in strength; it's a bit like smelling dirt now. It's always possible this is coincidental, but I wasn't exposed to smoke or anything that I think could cause my nose to go haywire.

50 2021-03-11 skin warm Patient received dose 1 of the Pfizer vaccine at a clinic. After the dose was administered the patie... Read more
Close
Patient received dose 1 of the Pfizer vaccine at a clinic. After the dose was administered the patient experienced tachycardia (pulse 110), elevated BP (measured with arm cuff at ~180/120), headache, and warmth. The patient was offered a cold pack, given water, and was taken away to a secluded room to relax under supervision. After about 1.5 hours the patient improved (BP 120/76 and pulse 85). The patient informed me that his rheumatologist recently had him stop his treatments for Crohn's disease in preparation to receive the vaccine. He stated that he had similar symptoms before when trying different treatment regimens for his underlying condition. The patient left on his own and no further adverse effects were reported.

On 13Feb2021, the patient had Soreness at the site of injection and fatigue for 24-48 hours after administration. The outcome of event was Recovered. No follow up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Close
I experienced muscle soreness at the injection site (upper-left arm) around 9P followed by cramping of my left calf. I went to bed and work up at 2A with body aches, stiffness, and joint throughout my body. The next day I continued experiencing the cramp in my leg and body aches, stiffness, and joint pain throughout my body, and general fatigue. The symptoms were mostly gone after my second night's sleep. I am still feeling lingering (mild) soreness and fatigue today, 4/2/2021.

50 2021-04-07 injection site pain First dose, next morning. Slight body aches low fever (below 100), lethargy and foggy headedness. ... Read more
Close
First dose, next morning. Slight body aches low fever (below 100), lethargy and foggy headedness. Arm hurt at injection site and pain spread slightly. All symptoms seemed worse day 2 post shot (3/17/2021). Persisted for about 4 days, gradually getting better. Went to work but was pretty miserable. Took Tylenol and Ibuprofin alternating every 2 hours for fever. Second dose next morning. Higher fever (topped at about 101 and change), severe fatigue, slept 18 hrs and took off work. Alternated tylenol and ibuprofin every 2 hours. Also chills, heavy night sweat body aches.. Next day, sub 100 fever that "rollercoastered" all day. Alternated tylenol and ibuprofin every 2 hours. Body aches, arm ached at injection site. Worked from home. Day 3 post injection (4/8/21) felt better, went to work, fine in the am, slight fatigue towards shift's end.

Vaccine administered 9.20am. Fatigue shortly after vaccine was administered - slept most of afternoon. Injection site pain - feels like been punched in arm. Headache in the evening. He spent most of the day "resting". Evening on day two, we noticed a large bump under his vaccinated arm. Radius about 5cm - larger than what I know swollen lymph nodes to look like - almost looks like a bicep between his armpit and nipple. Tender to touch. Morning of day three (48 hours after vaccine) bump under his arm remains and all other symptoms seem milder.

Close
About 6.5 hours after vaccination my throat got a bit dry and feeling like a start of a cold /raspy feeling and I felt two spots on the front of my neck itching. I looked in mirror and saw two pimple size type spots itchy. over the neck 30 mins another itchy pimple grew and neck got a bit red and under an ear got red and itchy. over the next hour my breathing felt a little more difficult, though oxygen level oximeter reading still good. 8.5 hours after vaccination both sides of my upper back/shoulders were covered in hives. I felt a bit foggy also. I administered epinephrine pen to my thigh. Over next few minutes the hives disappeared (except for a few pimple size spots though they basically disappeared)and the itch was gone. My breathing felt fine. I monitored signs and symptoms with no noticeable issues for the next day+. This was the 1st time I ever used an epi pen.

I also had some hives and redness about the diameter of 4 inches or so on the neck. I reported the symptoms at the site to a nurse at the front table of the waiting room. After about 25 minutes the itchness and redness kept subsiding. After about one hour the itchyness was over and the bumps had completely disappeared. I did not take any benadryl or epi pen.

Shot was received at 6:15pm and symptoms started at 7:30am. I had a soar arm at injection site. I slept from 2pm until 5:00pm. I went back to bed at 6:30pm. During the night I had cold chills and sweated all night until my sheets were drenched. I slept until 9:30am. I felt much better after taking a shower. I would not have the second dose!!
50 2021-04-16 injection site pain Had soreness and tenderness at injection within one hour of vaccination. Approximately 13-15 hours a... Read more
Close
Had soreness and tenderness at injection within one hour of vaccination. Approximately 13-15 hours after Vaccination, woke from sleep with fever and chills. Fever was 100 as measured using oral digital thermometer. Experienced mild body muscle aches and stiffness, especially in the upper back, shoulders and neck. Had mild to moderate fatigue and persistent headache at base of skull. Also experienced muscle twitching within 2 hours of vaccination through the lower limbs and torso, with more activity concentrated in the legs and feet. Was not painful, but strange. Some of this muscle fluttering and twitching preceded muscle cramping in the feet. Frequency was almost continuous with short, 60 second pauses between twitches. The moved and we?re not in the same exact location. We?re especially active when when lying flat, relaxed in bed. All symptoms aside from the twitching subsided fully by the following Morning (April 15th 2021). Took body temp that morning and had returned to 98.7 f. Muscle twitches have continued five days beyond vaccination, although they have grown milder and less frequent.

50 2021-04-17 injection site swelling, injection site pain High fever of 102 degrees. Took 2 caplets of Tylenol at 9pm on 04/09/2021 that had little to no eff... Read more
Close
High fever of 102 degrees. Took 2 caplets of Tylenol at 9pm on 04/09/2021 that had little to no effect. At 3am on 04/10/2021 took 2 gel caplets of Advil hoping to do better. The Advil brought the fever down to 100-101 for several hours but the fever went right back up. Arm was sore and had headache. My fever went down to 99 degrees 48 hours after taking the shot on 04/11/2021 at 3pm. Later on 04/11/2021 around 9pm my temperature went back to normal including any pain or swelling at the injection site. I had to re-hydrate myself but felt better. Overall I would do it again to protect my family from this virus.

Close
Bleeding of the gums began followed by black bloody mouth and lip blisters followed by small red/brown dots all over my lower legs and arms followed by black and blue bruises on legs and arms. Went to ER seven days after first noticed symptoms. Was admitted to ICU with platelet level near 2,000. Complete blood workup was done and everything was eliminated except Immune Thrombocytopenic Purpura (ITP). I was treated intravenously with immunoglobulin and steroids. On 4/21/21 I was released from the hospital with my platelet level near 49,000. Following up with hematologist on 4/26/21 for further testing and evaluation.

Close
Shortness of breath, heart palpitations, vertigo/dizziness, phantom body pains appearing and disappearing in various places, occasional itching sensation, numbness, brain fog, double-vision, extreme tiredness. Symptoms tapered off over 3-5 days. Similar experience with 2nd vaccine but less pronounced with a shorter timeframe, tapering off after 2-3 days. Strongest side effects after first vaccine, symptoms did not become noticeable until a couple of hours after it was administered, increasing next 24 hours before lessening over time. Basically identical to long covid symptoms but lasting only for a few days after vaccinations and not before.

50 2021-04-24 vaccination site pain headache; unable to maintain an erection/ some issues with maintaining an erection; soreness in his ... Read more
Close
headache; unable to maintain an erection/ some issues with maintaining an erection; soreness in his arms/ soreness was on both shoulders; real soreness" in his arm where he got the injection/ injection site had pain; developed a "large lymph node under that arm", which he "feels internally"/ lymph node he could feel internally/ internal bone like pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 50-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), second dose via an unspecified route of administration on 31Mar2021 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as SINGLE DOSE at the arm right (reported as right shoulder) for covid-19 immunisation (reported as he is trying to avoid serious illness). The patient medical history includes sleep from unknown date and if ongoing. Concomitant medication included zolpidem (reported as generic ambien) taken for sleep, start and stop date were not reported and added that he has been taking it for years but he hasn't taking it since he got the vaccine but thinks he took it the day before. The patient previously took bnt162b2 first dose on 10Mar2021 (roughly two weeks before the second dose) at the left shoulder for covid-19 immunisation. It was reported that the patient had no reaction to the first dose of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, and he received the second dose on 31Mar2021. He explained following the second dose, his first issue was a "headache", then he had "real soreness" in his arm where he got the injection. He added he developed a "large lymph node under that arm", which he "feels internally". He specified he still feels it a week later. He also explained he is "unable to maintain an erection". He described himself as "athletic" and specified not having erectile problem in the past. He asked if his current symptoms have been reported as side effect to the vaccine. It was also added that after the second dose he appeared to have some issues with maintaining an erection on 04Apr2021. It was stated he is fairly active with a muscular build and could be a result after an exercise injury but this did happen after his second shot. Caller states he also had soreness in his arms and an enlarged lymph node under his arm that he could feel with his hand but that went away yesterday (from 01Apr2021 to 07Apr20210). The soreness was on both shoulders but he thinks the soreness on the other shoulder is from lifting weights and the shoulder from the injection site had pain, internal bone like pain (from 01Apr2021 to 07Apr20210). It was stated that the lymph node he could feel internally but didn't protrude through skin and went away yesterday and lasted 6-7 days. It was also reported that the soreness and lymph node went away yesterday and believes everything will get back to normal, he expected soreness to last a couple of days and it lasted a week. The patient stated he took some sleep medication after the second injection. He doesn't remember if it was the night before the injection. He took Ambien, a higher dosage. States maybe issues with maintaining an erection are beginning to improve. It was also stated the soreness and lymph node he noticed it the day after the injection, by the evening of 01Apr2021 and as of yesterday 07Apr2021 evening it feels like its completely back to normal. It was noted for the treatment that he didn't take anything but bought a gripper where he squeezes it and builds strength in his hands to give him some relief. The patient added that he's pretty active, he works out 4-5 days a week, including running. The outcome of the event some issues with maintaining an erection/ unable to maintain an erection was recovering; for the event headache was unknown, for all other events was recovered on 07Apr2021. Information about the Lot/batch number has been requested.

50 2021-04-27 rash, skin burning sensation I received the Pfizer vaccine on 21 December 2021. On December 27 I developed a fever, cough and wa... Read more
Close
I received the Pfizer vaccine on 21 December 2021. On December 27 I developed a fever, cough and was diagnosed with Covid-19. About 14 days later I started to get a rash on hands and feet with burning sensation. I was evaluated and diagnosed with Covid toes. About 1 week later I developed a fever and was evaluated and diagnosed with pneumonia, pulmonary embolism, and a DVT. I continue to get worse to include arthritis in hands, wrists, feet and ankles. I was admitted to the hospital with worsening pneumonia, reactive arthritis and a rash on elbows, knees, hands and feet. I was in the hospital for about 5 days. I have been evaluated by rheumatology, pulmonary and dermatology since. The ongoing theory is I have a reactive arthritis from COVID and may have developed psoriasis/psoriatic arthritis.
50 2021-04-28 itchy skin, redness, hives During 15 minute observation period, patient complained of dizziness, lightheadedness and minor stom... Read more
Close
During 15 minute observation period, patient complained of dizziness, lightheadedness and minor stomach upset. Patient was instructed to sit down, his feet were elevated, a cold compress was applied. Patient's blood pressure, heart rate and pulse ox were taken. First blood pressure reading was 168/54 mmHg, first pulse was 71 bpm and pulse ox was 98-99%. Patient was shaky, anxious, and flushed. No complaints of shortness of breath, itching, or swelling of the face/mouth. Repeat vitals after 10 minutes were 185/105 mmHg, pulse was 76 bpm, and pulse ox was 100%. Patient was still dizzy and shaky. Administered 50 mg of diphenhydramine orally and contacted transport to emergency room. While waiting for transport, patient complained of forehead and forearm itching. Still no complaints of shortness of breath, no coughing or lip swelling. Noted red hives starting to appear. EMT arrived and took over care.
50 2021-04-28 rash, blister, redness Redness,rash and blisters on both ankle and wrists. Cramp under stomach
50 2021-04-28 hives, injection site pain, itchy skin On April 1, 2021, I received my 1st dose of the Pfizer vaccine at the Center and the only side effec... Read more
Close
On April 1, 2021, I received my 1st dose of the Pfizer vaccine at the Center and the only side effect from the vaccine at that time was localized soreness at the injection site of my left shoulder. On April 2, 2021, earlier that day the soreness at the injection site began to dissipate after doing push-ups and massaging my left arm. After going to bed last night and that night is when the additional side effects started. I was awakened by itching on both arms which had formed whelps from my shoulder to my forearm. For the next 13 days, the whelps and itching were sparsely during the day (which had consumed my legs, upper torso as well as arms) as they presented the illusion to be getting better but would flare up at night while sleeping. I attempted to do home remedies from Calamine lotion, Benadryl and cold showers but nothing seemed to effectively work against the itching and the whelps that resembled Hives. On April 13, 2021, while at work a new side affect began which was the swelling of my bottom lip (particularly the right half) along with itching in my throat. The swelling reduced itself as I continued to work through the night but the discomfort in my throat continued. The whelps and itching were still sparsely present as well. On April 14, 2021, later that morning, post work, the reduced swelling of my lower lip and throat discomfort I decided to go to the ER. While enroute to the ER, my top lip began to tingle and swell. These events made me more concerned about the severity I was experiencing since receiving the vaccine. After checking into the ER and being triaged, the doctor informed me that I would be hospitalized overnight due to the swelling of my upper lip, elongated tonsils, elevated blood pressure and the diagnosis of whelps as Hives. For the next three nights I was intravenous administered Epinephrine, Benadryl and Prednisone. On April 16, 2021, the third night I was discharged from the hospital with the same medications and informed to follow up with an allergist.
50 2021-04-30 rash vesicular Severe 'chicken-pox' like rash began on arms; face pustules; eruct; infection; scarring result; Low ... Read more
Close
Severe 'chicken-pox' like rash began on arms; face pustules; eruct; infection; scarring result; Low energy; digestive symptoms; skin problems; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient himself). A 50-year-old male patient received the second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in the right arm on 05Feb2021 at 12:00 (Batch/Lot Number: EL3249) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The vaccination facility type was reported as the hospital. Relevant medical history included asthma and known allergies to sulfur and intravenous (IV) contrast; all from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. Concomitant medications included lisinopril; atenolol; and omeprazole (PROTONIX); all taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. The patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) on 21Jan2021 at 12:00 PM (lot number: EK9231) at the age of 49 years, administered on the right arm for COVID-19 immunization. The patient had no other vaccine in four weeks. The patient had no prior vaccination. On an unspecified date in Mar2021 at 12:00 PM, the patient experienced severe 'chicken-pox' like rash began on arms; face pustules, eruct, infection; scarring result; low energy; and digestive symptoms in correlation with skin problems. All the adverse events (AE) resulted in a doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit and emergency room/department or urgent care; and had also led to disability or permanent damage. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures, which included COVID-19 test via nasal swab: inconclusive on 20Mar2021 (post vaccination). Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of all the events, which included topical corticosteroids, oral steroids, and oral antibiotic (antib). The patient was not recovered from all the events.

I have lower back pain on my left side; I have got a rash that looks like chicken pox; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 50-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm left (reported as "Firstly on right shoulder then corrected on left shoulder.") on 08Apr2021 (Lot Number: EN6203) (at the age of 50-year-old) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was not reported. Concomitant medications included hydrochlorothiazide taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported; lisinopril taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. The patient was suppose to call if he have any reactions to the vaccine, is that correct. So he have a reaction. He received his vaccine on Thursday (08Apr2021) and over the weekend. The patient have lower back pain on his left side and he have got a rash that looks like chicken pox on 10Apr2021. The patient next appointment is 11May2021 for second shot. The outcome of the events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

Close
Angioedema; Generalized urticaria (hives) all over trunk, arms, buttocks; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 50-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot number: ER8737; Expiration date was not reported) on the left arm on 06Apr2021 (13:15) as a single dose, with route of administration unspecified, for COVID-19 immunization at the pharmacy/drug store. Medical history included type 2 diabetes, hypertension (HTN) and obesity. Concomitant medications included atenolol, amlodipine, metformin hydrochloride, sitagliptin phosphate monohydrate (JANUMET) and simvastatin. The patient previously took buproprion (WELLBUTIN), and had drug allergy. On 07Apr2021 (14:00), the patient had angioedema and generalized urticaria (hives) all over the trunk, arms and buttocks. The events had resulted into doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. The patient had received methylprednisolone (MEDROL) as treatment for the reported event. The outcome of the event was not recovered. The patient did not have COVID-19 prior to vaccination, and had not been tested post-vaccination.
50 2021-05-03 skin irritation, rash 8 days post vaccine patient developed rash on left arm that spread to b/l arms and legs. Over the n... Read more
Close
8 days post vaccine patient developed rash on left arm that spread to b/l arms and legs. Over the next few days developed increased fatigue, severe joint pain, fever and worsening rash. Was seen in ER on 4/23/2021. Extensive work up showed increased CRP, Eosinophilia, increased LFTs, increased WBC. Skin biopsy was taken and revealed Superficial and deep perivascular and interstitial dermatitis, histiocyte-predominant and with eosinophils. ANA was positive 1:640, Ferritin was elevated. The patient was admitted. . Patient had CT scan of the chest on 4/28/2021 which showed bilateral pulmonary embolism and possible mass in the right side of the liver. Patient was started on anticoagulation. Next day, patient had severe abdominal pain with pain in the right lower quadrant. He as found to have Ogilivie's Syndrome with colon ischemia and peritonitis. Now s/p resection with septic shock. The patient is in the ICU and intubated.
50 2021-05-11 redness, itchy skin, skin peeling allergic to something in the shot./systemic histamine reaction; swollen lips; lips were flaking, ski... Read more
Close
allergic to something in the shot./systemic histamine reaction; swollen lips; lips were flaking, skin flaking; lips were flaking, skin flaking; massive facial angioedema/complete relapse of allergy/angioedema; fatigue; penis redness/penis was also "sheet red" and swollen; penis was also "sheet red" and swollen; itching; very very red face; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 50-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) at the age of 50-year-old, dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm on 25Mar2021 19:00 (Lot Number: ER8730; Expiration Date: 31Jul2021) as 1st dose, single for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included known allergies to spring pollen, oak birch, and ash. Concomitant medications included cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC) and levocetirizine dihydrochloride (XYZAL) taken as allergy medication. On 25Mar2021, the patient got the shot, waited 15 minutes, no problems. On 26Mar2021, woke up to a very very red face. On 27Mar2021, massive facial angioedema, fatigue, itching, notable penis redness, his penis was also "sheet red" and swollen. The patient started 4mg prednisolone on 27Mar2021, kept facial swelling and allergies at bay, mostly, but a very close rate to not keeping up. On 02Apr2021, swelling subsided and mostly was getting back to "normal", however lips were flaking, skin flaking. On 04Apr2021-week of, things got better, very swollen lips but everything reasonably in check. On 12Apr2021, the face re-firing red at approx 1pm, slept until 6pm, and complete relapse of allergy/angioedema. Trip to Emergency room (ER), given shot of Kenelog in the arm, released. On 13Apr2021, no improvement, steroids ended 6 days after the patient started taking them, 2nd trip to ER with epinephrine shot, no improvement; blood taken, white blood cell count normal. On 14Apr2021, allergist appointment and he was told that he was allergic to something in the shot triggers pollen allergies, rosacea, etc. 50mg prednisone 5 days, 40mg 5 days, etc. He states that it was a systemic histamine reaction. On 26Apr2021 starts up again, mild, contact me. The patient doesn't know what to do with the second vaccine in general and he had called and they say no on him getting number 2. He was terrified of vaccines now because of his reaction. He also says that he was not hospitalized but he went to the emergency room twice. The patient would like to know if there have been any reports of those who had a similar reaction to this getting the second dose of the vaccine and how they reacted. He states that he has been told that he should not get the second dose but wonders if he were to get another COVID-19 vaccine other than Pfizer, if he would have the same reaction. The event allergic to something in the shot/systemic histamine reaction resulted to doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. The event massive facial angioedema/ complete relapse of allergy/angioedema resulted to emergency room/department or urgent care. The patient was treated with steroids for the events. The outcome of the event massive facial angioedema/complete relapse of allergy/angioedema was not recovered while for the rest of the events was recovering.

shingles; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 50-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Batch/Lot Number: el92103), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 31Jan2021 14:45 (at the age of 50years) as 1ST DOSE, SINGLE for Covid-19 immunization. Medical history included hypertension high blood pressure and high blood cholesterol increased; both from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient reported that within 2 days of vaccine he started having left arm pain. On the 3rd day, he had arm pain with the start of a rash. On the 4th day, he had shooting pain down his arm to his hand, arm pain, and more rash. It is then that he sought out medical care and was diagnosed with shingles. The rash covered his left arm and 5 weeks later he was still suffering from extreme pain. The event onset date was reported as 02Feb2021. The adverse event resulted in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. The patient was treated for the adverse evet and he was on second round of antiviral's, pain medications. The patient has not been tested for COVID-19 since the vaccination. The outcome of event was not recovered.

Close
On 5/30/21, the day after vaccine administration, around noon hives appeared over entire body. No other symptoms reported. Patient self medicated with OTC diphenhydramine and hives improved but did not completely resolve. Hives flared up agian on 5/29/21 around noon. Patient did not want to continue with diphehydramine due to sleepiness. Patient instructed he could take a nonsedating antihistamine but would likely have less effectiveness and to keep diphenhydramine close by to use if needed. Patient instructed to seek medical attention if symptoms worsened, swelling or tingling in the lips tongue or throat, or a fever greater than 101. Patient contacted for follow up on 5/30/21 reported hives did reappear around midnight, he took diphenhydramine and they seem to have resolved. Instructed patient may need to speak with his PCP if this continues. Patient reports symptoms improvng and is not concerned at this time and aware of when to seek medical attention.

11 minutes after vaccine administration I began experiencing prickling sensation of mouth lips followed by prickling sensation of my tongue, increased heart rate and for a few seconds felt my throat tightening. I did not need to take any medications. 7 hours later I began experiencing itching all over my body however, I never developed a rash. My heart rate slightly increased. Simply did not feel well. The outcome of the events was recovering.

I am still sick; Fever/my fever was up to 101.7. It is down to 99 now but I still have the fever; Chills; Aches; joints ache; Some muscle pain; Headache; Tiredness; Injection side swelled up; feeling poorly; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable nurse (who is also the patient). A 51-year-old male patient received his first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EK9231, expiry date: 28Dec2020 (as reported)), via an unspecified route of administration, on 28Dec2020, at single dose, as a preventive measure for Covid. Medical history included blood pressure abnormal (reported as blood pressure). Concomitant medication included amlodipine besilate and amlodipine besilate (NORVASC 5 mg) both for blood pressure. The patient reported, "I received my first dose of Covid19 vaccine on Monday (28Dec2020) and it is now Friday and I am still sick and I am wondering how long these symptoms typically take to get better from because it seems like it is day 5 now so". When probed for events the patient stated, "Everything on the list, fever, chills, aches, my joints ache, some muscle pain, headache, tiredness, injection side swelled up. I was not nauseas or anything like that. I still have fever today. I did not get symptoms till like 2 days later and then my fever was up to 101.7. It is down to 99 now but I still have the fever." The patient mentioned, "I kind of like started feeling poorly on the 29th (29Dec2020) late at night but on the 30th (30Dec2020) I had fever and everything." The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included blood pressure measurement: is always good on an unspecified date, body temperature: 101.7 on 30Dec2020, body temperature: 99 on 01Jan2021 (reported as "I did not get symptoms till like 2 days later and then my fever was up to 101.7. It is down to 99 now but I still have the fever"), and laboratory test: unknown results on Dec2020 (reported as "I did go for full series of stuff, checkup but that was more than 2 weeks ago"). The outcome of the events was not recovered.

Extreme soreness to injection site, Flu-like symptoms including nausea, headache, fatigue, body aches, chills (during the evening), and mild diarrhea. Most symptoms were better by 6 PM on 1/9/2021. Diarrhea better by 1 PM 1/10/2021. (I had NONE of these after the first vaccination.)
51 2021-01-10 injection site pain I am a front line physician and got my first dose of Pfizer vaccine on 12/21/2020. For the first t... Read more
Close
I am a front line physician and got my first dose of Pfizer vaccine on 12/21/2020. For the first two days after the shot, I had only injection site soreness and mild headache, but nothing serious (Grade 1 effects). was able to go to work with that easily. On the tenth day (December 31, 2020) after dose 1 of Pfizer vaccine, I started to get severe myalgias, headache, chills, neck and back pain, mental fogging, malaise, altered taste, and fever spiking up to 101.2. I took Tylenol and tried to sleep. Woke up at 2 am with worst chills of my life, not improved my several blankets. My initial thought was that I have gotten COVID 19 before vaccine could take effect. I got 3 negative PCR tests done at hospital, first one on 1/2/2021 (day 3 of symptoms and day 13 after vaccine), second one on 1/5/2021 (Day 6 of symptoms and day 16 after vaccine), and third one on 1/8/2021 (Day 9 after symptoms and day 19 after vaccine). My symptoms are still persisting (today is Day 12 of symptoms and Day 22 after vaccine), but have slightly improved in last few days. I have not been able to do any activities of daily life (Grade 3). Have been taking Tylenol 3 times a day, bed rest, hydration. I have been the biggest supporter of the vaccines, but now totally unsure. I have talked to several ID and Immunology colleagues and nobody can explain it. I reviewed Pfizer EUA document, and on page 41, a subset of people have been described who had COVID type symptoms but negative tests. May be I have a n atypical delayed and prolonged systemic reaction to dose 1. I have decided not to take the Dose 2 and wait for a more traditional vaccine like Jonson and Johnson.

Dose 1 -Muscle twitched on injection into R deltoid. Immediately after injection experienced warm and cold sensations through right arm, intermittent pains along arm. Was asked to be observed 30 mins post injection. Sent home. Paresthesias (intermittent warm, cold, tingling sensations) continued with radiation into right axillary, and into neck. Experienced intermittent facial tingling. On day 3 post injection, started with burning eye discomfort in right eye. Went to eye doctor to rule out eye infection. No eye infection, Instructed to use Refresh drops. In 4 days subsided. Day 7 experienced ear flushing and warmth that last 3 days and subsided. Saw a neurologist to rule out nerve damage. EMG was normal. ANA titer was 1:40 with speckled and cytoplasma pattern. My last ANA was negative when tested for inflammation due to back pain few years prior. Neurologist did not think this was an allergic reaction and since symptoms were gradually improving recommended second dose. Symptoms fully resolved after 2 weeks Dose 2 - Jan 19 , 2021 (21 days post) - Decided to inject left deltoid to avoid trauma to right arm. Was observed 30 mins and released. No symptoms. Moderate arm soreness x 4 days. Day 3 post injection developed burning eye discomfort, intermittent tingling sensation in arm, warm/cold sensations. Pain radiating to shoulder and neck. Day 6 started very mild tingling and warm sensations in in cheek and chin area. Also experienced intermittent prickly sensations in throat and sensation of throat tightness predominantly on left side. (but no actual swelling). Today (Jan 26, 2021) is Day 7 and these intermittent sensations are persisting. Arm soreness has resolved. Right eye burning discomfort improving.

Injection site pain started a few hours after 1st dose COVID vaccine and hasn't fully resolved five weeks later. Range of motion is fine. Second dose was given slightly lower and with deltoid pulled out slightly by the vaccinator and wasn't painful. I saw my sports medicine doc yesterday (2/12/21) for routine follow-up to a right rotator cuff tear and had her examine my left shoulder as well. She says her exam of the L shoulder is consistent with bursitis and the history and exam suggest the 1st dose of the COVID vaccine was a bit too deep and at least some of the vaccine got into the bursa. I'm a physician working in public health with occupational exposures to COVID, so I'm concerned whether or not the vaccine will be effective if the first dose was injected deep to the deltoid.

He received his 1st dose vaccination 2/3/2021 and he began feeling sick on Sunday night 2/7/2021. He had pain and swelling along with an infection in his teeth and ears, cough and fever. No appetite, no smell, some chills, body aches and headaches. This past Saturday the 13th he said that he was having bad headaches and fatigue. He did also say that he was having vomiting but that had been after taking his antibiotic and medications for the shingles, basically his right side of his body.

Employee received initial Covid vaccine on 01/04/21 in lt deltoid area and developed pain in left elbow 72 hours post vaccination. Pain began subside over coming weeks and was nearly resolved by 1/22/21 when employee was seen for 2nd vaccine which was given in rt deltoid. EE reported that he had elbow pain but that it was nearly gone at time that he received 2nd dose. 48 hrs post 2nd vaccine EE began to experience sharp severe pain at same lt elbow and pain is still persisting currently. It is interfering with his ability to lift and his grip strength on the left at this time due to severity of pain. He agrees to be evaluated.

Universal hair loss: scalp, eyelashes, eye brows, pubic hair; Universal hair loss: scalp, eyelashes, eye brows, pubic hair; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 51-year-old male patient received second dose BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot number: EJ1686A) at the age of 51 years-old via unspecified route of administration on 08Jan2021 in left arm at single dose for COVID-19 immunization in the hospital. Medical history included GERD (Gastroesophageal reflux disease). The patient had no allergies to medications, food, or other products. Concomitant medication included VITAMIN D NOS. The patient previously took first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot number: EH9899) at the age of 51 years-old via unspecified route of administration on 20Dec2020 at 01:00 PM in left arm for COVID-19 immunization. No other vaccines have been administered within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. On 15Jan2021 patient experienced universal hair loss: scalp, eyelashes, eyebrows, pubic hair. No treatment received for the adverse events. Since the vaccination, the patient has been tested for COVID-19. Post vaccination patient underwent labs and procedure on 19Jan2021 included PCR (Polymerase chain reaction): negative, Nasal swab: negative. The outcome of events was not recovered. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

I napped a little but otherwise was just planted on the couch. The headache was the most annoying and steady. All symptoms were gone when I woke the next morning. My temp today is 97.7 and that?s a little higher than normal and my head still feels a little warm when someone else feels it and I feel still a tad warmer than normal. Otherwise I feel pretty good.

A 51-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection; Lot number was not reported) via an unspecified route of administration, at the age of 51-year-old, administered in Arm Right on 01Mar2021 13:00 as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. The patient experienced bell's palsy/experienced no mobility in the left side of the face and was diagnosed with bells palsy on 08Mar2021. The patient went to the ER in response to bell's palsy. ALOPECIA AREATA UNIVERSALIS: I have complete hair loss of my entire body. Head/ scalp, eyebrows, eye lashes, nose hairs, mustache, some armpits, chest hair, pubic/ groin hair, arm/ legs. 1. DEPRESSION/ sadness with no head/ scalp hair, eyebrows, eyelashes. Dramatic change of identity. I am BALD and my family/ friends/ patients think I have cancer b/c I have a CHEMO HEAD/ SCALP. 2. EYES/ NOSE/ THROAT irritation due to NOT having eyelashes or nose hairs. Watery eyes/ eye sensitivity due to dust/ environament, nasal congestion and irritation due to NO nose hairs. Time: 1st injection Dec 20, 2020 noticed some hair loss but after 2nd dose Jan 8, 2021 -> ALL HAIR GONE AFTER 1 WEEK. HAD PRIMARY CARE PHONE CALL JAN 27, 2021 TO REPORT W/ LABS (SEE BELOW) AND EARLIEST APPT WITH DERMATOLOGIST Feb 8, 2021: DX of alopecia areata universalis . TREATMENT AND STILL ON TREATMENT: 1. VITAMIN D2 1250 MCG WEEKLY, 2. 300 MG PREDNISONE PO EVERY 30 DAYS, ALLEGRA 120 MG DAILY, MINOXIDIL 5% TWICE DAILY

Close
Arm pain within 24 hours. However, the arm pain in my left should really start hurting on the ninth or tenth day after the 2nd dose. By the time I made it to urgent care, I was in serious pain to the point I had to raise both of my arms to help tolerate the pain. After the EKG was done to comfirm I wasn't having a heart attack, the Nurse Practitioner ordered a pain relief injection in my right hip and a prescription of ibuprofen 800 mg along with ice compression on my left arm where I received the 2nd dose.

51 2021-03-29 itchy skin Shortly after receiving the injection my arm went ice cold all the way to my fingers and warmed up a... Read more
Close
Shortly after receiving the injection my arm went ice cold all the way to my fingers and warmed up again quickly. On the way home (about an hour later) I noticed numbness and tingling in my hand and that has continued since (11 days as of this report). My upper arm muscle was sore later that evening and by the next day the pain in my upper arm was extreme. I couldn't move my arm without extreme pain. I took some tylenol late in the day and that did help cut down on some of the pain. I also put an ice pack on my upper arm but it didn't help. The pain wasn't as bad the next (3rd) day but it's still significant enough for me to restrict activity with it. There is also a burning sensation off and on as well as itching deep in my arm. My upper arm has also felt like there is a tight band around it (since day 2) although the muscles themselves don't feel like there's any tightness or knots. I took ibuprofen on day 10 and it helped a little but not a whole lot. At this point I also have what feels like swelling or tenderness under my arm near the armpit area. The pain, burning and itching in my upper arm continues as well as the numbness, tingling and pins all up and down my arm to my hand and fingers.

At 36 hours after the injection, I began to develop a skin rash, initially only on the underside of my right forearm. Over the following hours, the rash covered the entire underside of both forearms, from elbow to wrist; rash also extended from armpits down the side of the ribcage on both sides. Some rash also appeared across the ribcage and on the back, at the base of the spine down to the sacrailiac. Currently nearing 72 hours after injection. I also experienced considerable chills and muscle/joint aches, which has improved, but which has not yet disappeared.

When taking my morning shower a few days after my 2nd dose, I got large itchy bright red bumpy rashes on my right quadriceps area (about 12" wide by 6" wide", both ankle areas, and right forearm, plus a small area on my left inner forearm. This was mainly just a nuisance like mild poison ivy. The next day (today) it is not as red but it is still itchy. I do not know if the vaccine caused this, but thought that I should report it. It seems like not a big deal at all. I am very thankful for the vaccine.

Close
mild hives/rash on upper chest and back, itchy; no rash on right arm where shot was given. Hives with itch appeared about 3 hours after the shot was given, along with an itchy feeling in mouth and on tongue and feeling of strangeness in throat. I felt mostly normal during the 30 minutes after the shot, but developed a headache, chills, mildly upset stomach. I have anxiety issues and was nervous about getting shot so was hesitant to label anything as a side effect as it could be anxiety/panic disorder etc. But the rash/hives are itchy - I showered which made them itchier. I'm submitting this @ 10:30pm EST, my shot was @ 2pm EST - I have taken more zyrtec worried I am having an allergic reaction. I am filing this because I am worried about the 2nd shot - I do not want to have a worse allergic reaction after the 2nd shot. I will call my allergist. He manages my allergies and advised me to continue taking my seasonal allergy meds and zyrtec as normal during the shot today. Presently there are no hives/itch on any other parts of my body except my upper chest and upper back.
51 2021-04-03 rash, itchy skin I got the vaccine on Tuesday morning. On Thursday morning when I woke up, the skin around my left ey... Read more
Close
I got the vaccine on Tuesday morning. On Thursday morning when I woke up, the skin around my left eye was red (like in a rash) and the eye was swollen. By Friday morning, my other eye was swollen as well and I developed a rash on my upper right chest (very close to the collar bone). By Saturday morning, my symptoms had worsened slightly. I went to urgent care to see a doctor at 1 PM. They were not sure if this was a reaction to the vaccine. They asked me if I had exposure to poison oak, I didn't (although I do have severe allergy to poison oak). They recommended taking Allegra 180mg twice a day. Doctor recommended taking the second dose of the vaccine per plan on 4/20 but starting Allegra 1 day before that and continue to take it until 3 days later. I have occasional itching but no pain.
51 2021-04-04 redness, itchy skin, hives Roughly 11 hours after the injection, 75% of my body was covered in hives. I was very itchy and red... Read more
Close
Roughly 11 hours after the injection, 75% of my body was covered in hives. I was very itchy and red. The next day I did a televisit through my health insurance provider's website and saw a medical professional who advise that I treat the hives with OTC drugs like Benedryl & Pepcid. I also used topical creams like Cortisone & Gold Bond. I soaked in a bath with an oatmeal powder. Also used an ice pack. I got very little temporary relief from these treatments. The medical profession said to not use a steroid as no one is sure what that could do to the effectiveness of the vaccine. This has gone on now for over three full days now and I'm following up with my regular medical practice today. The affected areas (most of my body) look slightly better today but I'm still just as itchy. In addition, my top lip was slightly swollen when I woke up today but has since gone down. I haven't had any respiratory issues.

Currently, developed 3 blood clots in right arm 4 days after receiving the vaccination. First was noticed on the morning of April 6, the second in the evening of April 6, and the third was noticed on the morning of April 7. First one has appearance of cellulitis located on the forearm. Doctor issued treatment for cellulitis on April 6. Reddish/purple skin colored with grey edges in a circle. Second clot is below the skin with slight bulge closer to the elbow than the first. The third indication is in the upper arm above the elbow on inside of arm. Appearance marked by 2 curved lines similar to varicose veins just below where the clot is bulging the skin. No discoloration of the 2nd and 3rd indications of clot.

51 2021-04-26 itchy skin, eczema, dry skin, rash with redness, rash Skin became severely dry and itchy. Rash and nonspecific skin eruption. Blanching erythematous papul... Read more
Close
Skin became severely dry and itchy. Rash and nonspecific skin eruption. Blanching erythematous papules and excoriation on arms and upper back. No rash in groin. Well developed, well nourished, male in no acute distress, oriented and without outward signs of anxiety or depression. Complete examination of the scalp and hair, head, face, ears, nose, lips, eyelids and conjunctiva, neck, chest, breasts and axillae, back, abdomen, right and left arms, digits/nails, right and left legs was normal except for the following significant findings: - Erythematous papules coalescing in areas into nummular plaques with scattered excoriations on the back, flanks, lower legs. Eczematous dermatitis - Start Triamcinolone acetonide 0.1% ointment BID over affected area, no more than 2 weeks per month. - Reviewed side effects of prolonged steroid use including skin atrophy, telangiectasia, hypopigmentation, and striae. - Recommended bathing with lukewarm water, using minimal fragrance-free soap only in intertriginous areas. Options include Cetaphil and Dove. - We discussed the importance of regular moisturizing (2-3x per day) with an emollient (Hydrolatum or Aquaphor) or thick cream (Cetaphil, CeraVe, Vanicream, Eucerin etc) even when eczema seems to be doing well. - For itch and poor sleep, start hydroxyzine 25 mg PRN at bedtime. Reviewed potential SE including sedation.

Close
I have sever lower back problems from time to time and the first vaccine, in March, triggered severe spasms and fatigue which I reported. Thankfully, they go away within a day or so, but the rashes are annoying, especially bc they seem to be spontaneous. Also, when I got the second shot, it felt like someone was grabbing my heart from time to time on the morning of my shot. Sorry for only reporting this now.

sick; With the first dose he got tired and had malaise, and body aches for two days; With the first dose he got tired and had malaise, and body aches for two days; With the first dose he got tired and had malaise, and body aches for two days; felt warmth in the arm; hot flash; just got really hot; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient himself). This 52-year-old male received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot number ELO140), via an unknown route, on 23Dec2020 (at 06:00 AM), at single dose in the left upper arm on 23Dec2020 for COVID-19 immunization, administered at hospital. The patient had COVID-19 from 17Jul2020 to 14Aug2020 for which he was not hospitalized but he was pretty sick and had circulations issues; he had a little of numbing and tingling in his left three fingers after COVID virus. The patient clarified left three fingers as his middle finger, index finger, and ring finger. He had numbing and tingling in his toes as well. Relevant concomitant medications included ubidecarenone (COQ-10), rosuvastatin calcium (CRESTOR OD), monascus purpureus (RED YEAST RICE PLUS), and acetylsalicylic acid (BABY ASPIRIN). With the first dose he got tired and had malaise, and body aches for two days: He got the vaccine after working that night (He works in the intensive care unit). He got it at 6:00 AM. He felt warmth in the arm. It went all the way down the left arm. He got a hot flash. He stayed there for 15 minutes and was fine, but just got really hot. He finished his shift and didn't have any other reactions. He went to sleep and woke up in the afternoon on the 23Dec2020 and went to work. He didn't feel anything at that time. He was working six or seven days in a row. When he was working that night was when he started feeling body aches and fatigue. He didn't even put two and two together that it was from the vaccine. He felt like he needed to take something. His body temp was normally 97 and when he checked it was 98. He took a little ibuprofen (MOTRIN) and felt a lot better after taking it. He slept when he got home and had body aches and fatigue for a couple of days. He cancelled going away for a couple of days. By noon on 25Dec2020 he was feeling like he was getting back to normal. He continued to lay around all day and didn't do much. He was sick with the first and was expecting to be more sick with this one. He wanted to give himself an extra day before he had to go back to work. The patient had recovered from the event 'with the first dose he got tired and had malaise, and body aches for two days' on 25Dec2020 while the outcome of the remaining events was unknown.

From about 24 hours for maybe the next 4 days, significant aggravation of legacy rashes from my chronic skin conditions. After 4 days, they reverted to normal.

Medical history was not reported. Patient had no allergies to medications, food, or other products. Concomitant medications included sertraline hydrochloride (ZOLOFT), atorvastatin (LIPITOR) and amlodipine besilate (NORVASC). The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient received other medications within 2 weeks of vaccination. On an unknown date in Jan2021 at 09:30 AM, the patient experienced soreness at injection site in arm lasting 2 days. The patient assessed the event as non-serious. No treatment was received in response to the adverse event. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. Since the vaccination, patient was not tested for COVID-19. The patient recovered from the event on an unspecified date in Jan2021. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

Swelling, tenderness and stiffness at the injection site; Swelling, tenderness and stiffness at the injection site; Swelling, tenderness and stiffness at the injection site; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 52-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EL 3247), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 04Feb2021 at 11:00 AM at the age of 52 years old at a single dose for COVID-19 Immunization at workplace clinic. The patient medical history was none. Allergies to medications, food, or other products was none. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient didn't receive other medications within 2 weeks of vaccination. On 04Feb2021 at 15:00, the patient experienced swelling, tenderness and stiffness at the injection site, developed approximately 4-5 hours after injection. Stiffness disappeared overnight; swelling and tenderness increased overnight (now 21 hours post injection). Area was very tender, didn't affect ability to execute job function. The patient assessed the events as non-serious. No treatment was received in response to the adverse event. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. Since the vaccination, patient was not tested for COVID-19. The patient recovered from the event stiffness on an unspecified date in Feb2021 and recovering from other events. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

52 2021-03-14 redness, rash within two hours of the second dose, the patient experienced red skin in face and hands, muscle ache... Read more
Close
within two hours of the second dose, the patient experienced red skin in face and hands, muscle aches and fatigue. After four hours the patient experienced swollen lymph nodes. Although his lymph nodes were swollen on his left and right side, the lymph nodes on the patients left side (same side as the injection) were more swollen and sensitive to the touch. The next day, joint pain and muscle fatigue persisted, the patients also experiences chills and small blemishes on his face and left arm. On the night of 13 March 2021, patients experienced fever of approximately 99.5 degrees Fahrenheit (F). After taking 1000mg of Acetaminophen, the fever was reduced to 89.9 F. Two hours later, patent's temperature rose to 101.5 F. Patent then took 800mg of Ibuprofen. This brought the patient's temperature down to 99.5. Then he went to sleep. The next day 14 March, the patent experienced a sore throat and higher fever. He went to the urgent Clinic for examination.

The patient medical history included depression. The patient had no allergies to medications, food, or other products. The patient concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot number: EL3249) on 12Jan2021 08:30 via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm as a single dose for COVID-19 Immunization. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient did not have any other medications the patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination. The patient was not diagnosed with Covid-19 prior to vaccination and not tested for COVID-19 since vaccination. On 03Feb2021 05:30, the patient had the 1st shingles flare-up of his life and it began the day after receiving the second dose of vaccine. The rash was mainly on his left arm, which is the same arm where he got the vaccination shot (both times). On 09Feb2021 doctor's nurse-practitioner confirmed suspicion of shingles. The event assessed as non-serious by the reporter. The patient prescribed Valtrex for the treatment of the event. The outcome of the events was not recovered. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information was expected.

52 2021-04-06 rash, rash with redness, itchy rash, hives Two weeks after the first vaccine I broke out in hives. It started as an itch in my foot and my ankl... Read more
Close
Two weeks after the first vaccine I broke out in hives. It started as an itch in my foot and my ankles. It worked its way up my legs and then to my flank. I took a course of Prednisone but after I finished the course the hives came back. I had gotten it under control with Zyrtec and Benadryl and then switched to Allegra. I had just gotten it under control when I got the second dose and the hives started again exactly two weeks after that dose. The hives started again, and I am still getting them after 12 weeks and I cant get them under control. They are moving around my body in patches up and down my body from top to bottom and then back to top. The worst is when it is on my torso. They are red and inflamed spots that are raised and itchy. Everyday it is in a different place. I have taken three courses of Prednisone. In the last few days, they have become more dispersed around my body. I even have them in the palms of my hands, the bottom of my feet and on my ears and the top of my head. I have never had any allergies before. I got both vaccines in the left arm. Currently, I am still taking Allegra twice a day plus a prescription at night. I have consulted with a dermatologist, an Allergist and my Primary Care Physician.

2:30pm - Vaccine administered. Some muscle soreness at the vaccination site, but otherwise no noticeable side effects. 1am - 10 hours after vaccine. All over body shaking. Not unlike "chills" but didn't have the cold feeling with it. No accompanying fever at the time. Lasted until 5:30am. 6am - 15 hours after vaccine . Shortly after the shaking stopped, spiked a 101.5 degree fever. That continued until approximately 5am the following day. Took 500mg acetaminophen at 7am, and again at 4pm, and again at 12am. Throughout the following day - 15 hours to 36 hours after vaccine - general body aches (most noticeable in the back), lethargic - but that could have been a result of no sleep the night prior due to shaking. 5pm following day - 27 hours after vaccine - bad headache. That lasted until midnight 5am the next morning - most all side effects gone. Some lethargy but temperature at 98.6 degrees, body aches no longer apparent, headache gone.

Therapeutic measures were taken, and treatment included prednisone and EpiPen. The outcome of the events was reported as Not recovered. A 52-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration on 15Apr2021 10:00 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was not reported. There were no concomitant medications. Facility type vaccine was Pharmacy or Drug Store. There was no other vaccine in four weeks nor other medications in two weeks. The patient broke out in a rash (chest - neck - arms - legs - back) with extreme itching, face was swollen (eyes - lips - ears). Patient went to the hospital and was given IV drip with Benadryl - steroids for treatment. Patient was then sent home but the rash and itching still persist. He then went to my doctor and was given 2 shots of steroids and Prednisone 10mg. The events onset date was reported as 16Apr2021 16:00. The adverse events resulted in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, Emergency room/department or urgent care, Life threatening illness (immediate risk of death from the event). The outcome of events was recovering. Patient had no COVID prior vaccination nor tested COVID post vaccination. No known allergies. Information on the lot/ batch number has been requested.

Close
Approximately 4 hours after the shot, my vace and head broke out in with what look like "in grown hairs". The next morning, 4/23, my lymph nodes on the side of my neck, and under the tip of my chin swelled up significantly. Still there... Then the headache started (4/23), and is still ongoing. This is accompanied with major body aches, a very low grade fever, and occasional chills. Today, 4/27 at approximately 6:30pm, I started puking. I'd rather roll the dice with Covid then get a second shot!!!!!!
