52 2021-05-18 shingles muscles tight; shingles; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 52-ye... Read more
Close
muscles tight; shingles; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 52-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), via an unspecified route of administration (at the age of 52-years-old), administered in Arm Right on 12Apr2021 13:45 (Lot Number: ER8731; Expiration Date: 31Jul2021) as 1st dose, single for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included psoriatic arthritis (diagnosed with this for a few years, like maybe 6 or 7 years), cholesterol. Concomitant medications included pravastatin and ezetimibe, both taken for cholesterol and from unspecified start dates and ongoing. The patient experienced shingles on 17Apr2021, muscles tight on an unspecified date. He received the 1st dose of the Pfizer-BioNTech Covid-19 Vaccine on 12Apr2021. Then on 17Apr2021, he developed a red spot on his shoulder (on left shoulder, It was a red spot with bubbles filled with fluid), cold chills, and a "funny feeling" or pain on his left hand or arm ("Then, he went and got worse. Then, he had chills and no fever but he had cold chills"). He added that Saturday morning, he was not feeling right. Then added that it was like Friday he had a cold or something. He adds that he does not get high fevers so he thought he had like allergies but it was not so, and he had cold spells. He did not have a fever. The skin on his left hand felt funny when he was touching it, it was almost painful. Like, when someone touches their hand it feels okay but this almost felt painful to touch. It was his left hand. It was his left shoulder almost close to his neck where the red spot was. Saturday, he saw the spot and felt symptoms. He thought maybe he touched something, or something bit him. Sunday, the symptoms did not go away. He started feeling worse, feeling sick but not a fever. He said it persisted until Sunday. By Monday morning, because his wife is a daycare director, he told her he got sicker and not to go because he felt sick and he did not know if he had COVID or he did not know what he had. They went to the clinic to make sure it was not COVID. He got tested for COVID, but also told them he discovered the red spot and he had symptoms. They tested him for COVID and it was negative. The doctor looked at the red spot and saw his symptoms and said that patient has shingles. He then was diagnosed with shingles and was given medication for it. The doctor told him all the signs were matching with shingles. Patient asked the doctor if this is related to the vaccine and the doctor said honestly she does not know if it is related. He was given a drug for 7 days, Valacyclovir. Treatment: Valacyclovir 1000 MG 3 times a day for 7 days. He started this medication on Monday. He has also taken Advil. The doctor told him to take Advil. He usually takes it in the morning, and then if he starts to need it because shingles can make people feel cold and flulike symptoms from the shingles. It goes away but it is not consistent. He takes it whenever he does not feel well. The headache is because of the spot the infection is, close to his neck. It gets muscles tight and that creates pressure. It is hard for him to lay down and sleep because of the shingles. He wanted to know if this is a normal reaction with the vaccine and if he should still receive the 2nd dose, and what he should do next. Currently, symptoms "Skin on left hand felt funny" comes and goes, "cold chills" got better but did not go away completely. All the symptoms, like usually he will take Advil, and they will go away. He adds that the chills will go away and get better as the days progress with medications. He did not have a cough. The headaches were intense. The red spot on shoulder, the dot is on his left side of his chest and it moves around, now it is bigger on his chest. The shingles expanded and went to his chest, too. Shingles are painful and no fun. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included SARS-CoV-2 test: negative on 19Apr2021. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result. The outcome of the events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

52 2021-06-01 vaccination site pain, vaccination site mass feels like there are little tiny baby hands pinching his internal organs throughout his abdomen; Eye... Read more
Close
feels like there are little tiny baby hands pinching his internal organs throughout his abdomen; Eyes swollen and his vision was diminished; Eyes swollen and his vision was diminished; On his injection arm- 2 inches away from the injection site appeared a size of a gigantic golf ball/A huge lump appeared a few inches from injection site; Numbness from his ankle to his feet and from his knees to his feet/numbness in legs and feet; feels like it's cold and tingly; feels like it's cold and tingly; ringing ears; pressure in his neck to his injection site; back pain/pain in back; vision is blurry; throat was swollen.; Toes locking up; Really dizzy and really lightheaded; Mind has been foggy; Glands were swollen; Arm soreness; Nose is bone dry; tiredness/tired; injection site pain/injection site soreness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient, self-reported). A 52-years-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTEC COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection, lot number: EW0173 and expiry date was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration, in Arm Left, on 08May2021 at 02:38 PM, as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient did not receive any other vaccine in four weeks. The patient's medical history included Bug bite (happened 5 days prior to 30Apr2021 and regimen of an antibiotic). He was completely done with the rotation for a least 8 days before he got the vaccine. It might have something to do with this. concomitant medication included dicloxacillin (started it on 30Apr2021 and it was for 5 days. He did not know what it did was). The patient reported that on 08May2021, day one, he experienced, tiredness and injection site pain. On day 2, until now side effects which had not gone away. It hadn't gotten worse, but it was not any better. The patient felt like congestion, but his nose was bone dry, like crusty dry. It hurts a little bit because it was so dry and he had arm soreness, nothing out of the ordinary. The arm soreness was just normal injection stuff. At first it was a little tender on the injection spot. It went away after about a day. On 10May2021, the patient felt like there were little, tiny baby hands pinching his internal organs randomly throughout his abdomen. It was not a sharp pain, more like a little squeeze all through his abdomen. It felt like his whole throat was swollen. It was not visually swollen, it more felt like a football in his neck. Stretching it was helping. His toes have been locking up like a pre-clamping. He had numbness from his ankles to his feet for 8 days, and now he has numbness from his knees to his feet. It was not completely numb, but it was not normal. The feeling of baby hands pinching his internal organs started the second day after the vaccine and has stayed consistent. The patient's eyes swollen, and his vision was diminished. Day 2 through today, it felt like his eyes were swollen, his vision was seriously diminished, he had a golf ball sized welt on his arm not at the injection site but 2 inches from it, and he was really dizzy and really lightheaded and almost fainted at the corner store. The feeling like his eyes were swollen started on day 3 after the vaccine. The crease of his eye be-low the eyebrow and on top of the socket got red and puffy and looked like sunburnt skin does. It was at the point that now it feels swollen all the time almost like he had pink eye and his vision has been diminished about 30%. He had a test done yesterday and his vision was 20/25. Some-times he could not even read a text and had to stare at his phone for 10 minutes to make out words. He did not have these issues before. The feeling of his eyes being swollen was a little better in the mornings and about 1300 it gets worse when he gets lightheaded to where was when it started. His vision became diminished about day 3 after the vaccine. It was a little better in the morning, but in the afternoon, it goes to exactly the same as when it started. He noticed the golf ball sized welt on his arm about 3 days ago. The doctor seemed to think a drop of the injection might had travelled from the injection site and his body was creating a defense to it. It was scary to take a shower and then see that. It didn't hurt. It was not painful, but it was a weird foreign entity. The cramping in his toes started probably day 3 and was consistent. The numbness started on day 2 after the vaccine, and up until 3 days ago it was just his ankles and feet. 3 days ago, it got to the point where it was from his knees to his feet. It has gotten worse since it was now travelling up his legs. On his injection arm- 2 inches away from the injection site appeared a size of a gigantic golf ball - when asked with his doctor he said that he thinks that a drop of the vaccine travelled and his body building a reaction to it and it was very abnormal. The patient also had numbness from his ankle to his feet worsened and from his knees to his feet- almost feels like it was cold and tingly. The patient also had dizziness and lightheaded about day 2 after the vaccine and it was the same. It came in waves but was consistent throughout the day. He would be fine then had a wave of dizziness. He has been laying down so much because he was so tired, ringing ears, felt like his glands were swollen, pressure in his neck to his injection site, and back pains. The patient stated that his doctor was only form urgent care. The patient Felt like whole throat was swollen, toes locking up, really lightheaded, mind has been foggy, and arm soreness. The patient had bizarre side effects from the Covid Vaccine for 11 days now. He thought it was the smart thing to report them to Pfizer. He didn't like to give personal information. He declined to give his mailing address or his email address. He hated when asked for race, but he guessed it might be important. He did not have a mailing address, phone number, or email address handy for his physician. He went to Urgent Care yesterday to have it checked and they did an EKG and said he had to be sent by ambulance to the ER. The doctor did bloodwork, and she said everything looked alright and to rest a few more days and keep hydrated. The patient underwent the lab work and procedures which included chest X-ray with unspecified result. He thinks it was on 18May2021. His mind has been foggy with all of that. It was yesterday or the day before. He could not be sure. He has been sleeping so much and was in a complete daze. The fogginess he had the whole time as his other symptoms, and it was the same. He has been eating well and hydrating and taking a multivitamin and Gatorade, all the things' people say to do. He asked if Pfizer has heard of this before. He was panicked it might be chronic, and he worries about the safety of the second shot for him. He was sure many people haven't reacted, but these are freaky side effects. He asked for advice and if Pfizer had heard of this before or if he was some weird anomaly. On his way to get the vaccine he asked 2 people at the city health line if they had taken it and they both said no. He asked 3 other patients and they said they took the Pfizer. One woman said she will take it when they make her. The guy who gave him the shot lied and said he wasn't eligible. It might have been his way of not having to discuss it. The events resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, Emergency room/department or urgent care. The patient was not diagnosed with Covid prior vaccination. The patient was tested for Covid post vaccination with Nasal Swab on 18May2021. The outcome of the events was not recovered. Device Date: 23May2021,Additional information has been requested.

The patient stated he just wished the vaccine dosage had a high of like if it was 0.3 maybe should be 0.2. The patient stated there should be a different regimen based on height and weight. The reporter was thinking of taking the patient to urgent care. Mild injection arm soreness for 3-4 hours after injection. Mostly asymptomatic on the day of injection. No constitutional symptoms until 24 hours later. Then subacute onset of headache, fever 38 C, sweats, sleepiness for approximately 12 hours. Asymptomatic by 48 hours later.
53 2021-01-12 vaccination site pain swelling of the lymph nodes; fever; right arm injection site pain; aches and pains; chills; This is ... Read more
Close
swelling of the lymph nodes; fever; right arm injection site pain; aches and pains; chills; This is a spontaneous report from a Pfizer-sponsored program via a contactable consumer (patient). A 53-year-old male patient received the first dose bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Batch/lot number: EL0140), intramuscular on 04Jan2021 at 13:00 at single dose in right shoulder for covid-19 prophylaxis. There were no medical history or concomitant medications. The patient experienced fever, right arm injection site pain, aches and pains, and chills on 05Jan2021, swelling of the lymph nodes on 06Jan2021. Event details: On 05Jan2021 in the morning, he started having a fever and chills. He stated that he noticed the injection site pain on the 05Jan2021 and stated that it only hurt at time of reporting if he pushed on it. He stated it did not hurt when he moved his arm around. The patient stated that he noticed the aches and pains on the 05Jan2021 in the morning and it stuck with him throughout the day and was over by the time he went to bed on 05Jan2021. Wednesday 06Jan2021, toward the early morning around 0300 under his arm hurt and the lymph node under his arm was swollen about the size of a baseball. The patient said that his fever was currently 99.5 in Jan2021. The outcome of events fever and swelling of the lymph nodes was not resolved, outcome of right arm injection site pain, aches and pains was resolved in Jan2021, outcome of event chills was unknown.
53 2021-01-13 injection site pain Headache; migraine; tenderness at injection site; Ten hours after injection he had shaking, sweats, ... Read more
Close
Headache; migraine; tenderness at injection site; Ten hours after injection he had shaking, sweats, hot and cold flashes, and augmentation of myalgias; Ten hours after injection he had shaking, sweats, hot and cold flashes, and augmentation of myalgias; Ten hours after injection he had shaking, sweats, hot and cold flashes, and augmentation of myalgias; Ten hours after injection he had shaking, sweats, hot and cold flashes, and augmentation of myalgias; Ten hours after injection he had shaking, sweats, hot and cold flashes, and augmentation of myalgias; Fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (patient). A 53-year-old male patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EK9231), via an unspecified route of administration on right deltoid on 05Jan2021 07:45 at single dose for covid-19 immunization. Family history included migraine (other family members). Medical history included mild blood pressure and kidney stones, reactive airway disease. Concomitant medication included colecalciferol (VITAMIN D), potassium, allopurinol and hydrochlorothiazide/valsartan for mild blood pressure and kidney stones, fluticasone propionate, salmeterol xinafoate (ADVAIR) for reactive airway disease, atorvastatin, and multivitamins. The patient previously took fluticasone propionate, salmeterol xinafoate (ADVAIR) and experienced dry mouth and lost sense of taste. The patient also previously took Tdap booster on Aug2020, Shingrix on 10Aug2020, and influenza on 12Oct2020; all for immunization; and tetanus injections for immunization and experienced localized tenderness. The patient had the first dose of BNT162B2 (lot number: EH9899) for COVID-19 immunization on 15Dec2020 and experienced localized tenderness at injection point. The received his second dose of COVID vaccine on 05Jan2021. With the first dose he had increased localized tenderness at injection site on 15Dec2020, and he rated it mild to moderate. He would say it was 80% resolved in 24 hours. It had completely resolved in 36 hours. He would say that he has recovered completely form the localized tenderness with the first dose. Then he noted his second dose was yesterday, in the context of not having much sleep the night before. The actual injection was uncommonly eerily painless. The other folks in his department had similar experience. Maybe it was the nurse who gave the injection. Maybe it was because it was the same area and sensitivity was decreased. They had to check the Band-Aid to make sure blood was there. The administration was painless. He was relieved when the arm started getting sore to know he actually received it. He had increased arm tenderness at injection site which he rated as moderate which has now resolved. It got to moderate where lifting the arm up was sore. He definitely knew that he had been vaccinated. He got the vaccine at 7:45AM and now it is 16 to 17 hours later and he would say the pain is mild now. It did persist. The first vaccine hurt a little more. He expects this to go away. Ten hours after injection he had shaking, sweats, hot and cold flashes, and augmentation of myalgias. He had unrelenting headache over night that was moderate to severe. He said it kept him awake. It was exacerbated by lying down. Sitting up helped him. It became a migraine which is something he doesn't often experience. Migraines are pretty rare for him. He took 800mg of Advil at 6AM that helped for headache and migraine. The weight of the patient was 250 to 255 pounds. Shaking, sweats, hot and cold flashes, and augmentation of myalgias have resolved. Everything has resolved except for a little headache. In the background he literally had one or two hours of sleep. He thinks that likely precipitated a migraine was increased. Last night he slept literally an hour. He took 800mg of Advil and fell asleep. He is operating on 2 hours of sleep in 48 hours. Most of the stuff is gone except a little headache and expected fatigue. Headache Seriousness Criteria: he would say that it was relatively disabling. He would not have been able to carry on. He wouldn't have been able to operate last night. It would have interfered. It was dissimilar to others. He gets rare migraines. Everything was amplified with a migraine. He certainly felt that. It was fair to say the vaccine precipitated the migraine that was mild or severe. He doesn't want to falsely attribute these things to the vaccine. Causality Headache: precipitated by the vaccine. In the context that he had not slept the night before. He had a nasopharyngeal COVID test and it was negative. He has been in a COVID study where they are looking at combination. They developed a saliva test at (Name). There is a combination of saliva oropharyngeal and immunoglobins. He has been negative multiple times. The outcome of the events headache and fatigue was not recovered and recovered for the rest of the events.; Sender's Comments: A causal association between BNT162B2 and the reported event headache cannot be excluded based on a compatible temporal relation between vaccination and onset of events. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to RAs, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

53 2021-01-17 vaccination site pain Increasing mild to moderate local tenderness at the deltoid of the injection arm; This is a spontane... Read more
Close
Increasing mild to moderate local tenderness at the deltoid of the injection arm; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician. A 53-year-old male patient received the 1st dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2) (lot# EH9899), via an unspecified route of administration in right deltoid, on 15Dec2020 at 07:45 AM, at single dose, for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included reactive airway disease, Blood pressure abnormal, kidney stones, no sense of taste or smell (Between Dec2019 and Jan2020 or Feb2020), migraine, ongoing obesity (250 to 255 pounds). Family history included migraine (family members). Previously the patient was immunized with diphtheria vaccine toxoid, pertussis vaccine acellular, tetanus vaccine toxoid (TDAP) (booster) in Aug2020, varicella zoster vaccine rge (cho) (SHINGRIX) on 10Aug2020, influenza vaccine (unknown manufacturer) on 12Oct2020, tetanus vaccine (unknown manufacturer) and experienced mild arm soreness. Previously the patient received fluticasone propionate, salmeterol xinafoate (ADVAIR) from Dec2020 and experienced dry mouth and lost sense of taste. Concomitant medications included multivitamin (unknown manufacturer), fluticasone propionate, salmeterol xinafoate (ADVAIR DISKUS INHALER) from 2020 for reactive airway disease, allopurinol (unknown manufacturer) for kidney stones, atorvastatin (unknown manufacturer), potassium (unknown manufacturer); hydrochlorothiazide, valsartan (VALSARTAN AND HYDROCHLOROTHIAZIDE) for blood pressure abnormal, colecalciferol (VITAMIN D). The patient experienced increasing mild to moderate local tenderness at the deltoid of the injection arm on 15Dec2020 with outcome of recovered in Dec2020 (in 36 hours). On unspecified dates the patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included COVID-19 antibody test, COVID-19 PCR test, salivary test: all negative.
53 2021-01-18 injection site pain Right after vaccine administered, I noticed that the injection site seemed a bit high and more in my... Read more
Close
Right after vaccine administered, I noticed that the injection site seemed a bit high and more in my shoulder than my upper arm. Did not think much more of it until pain started about four hours later then at 0130 in the morning awoke with much throbbing in arm such that I took 600mg ibuprofen in order to sleep. The site remains very tender to touch not warm or red and the injection site is just under my left acromion process shoulder area. I work in the ED and must use this arm for airway management procedures. Fortunately I am off clinical duties until Tuesday, Jan. 19, so hopefully pain will subside by then, but I do not think I could intubate anyone in my current state. I do not think this is a reaction to the vaccine per se but more so a result of the site of injection in my tendon/bursa area of my shoulder. At this time, I cannot move my left shoulder without pain. I am trying to perform ROM exercises to hopefully reduce the time of discomfort overall. I also have some vague sense of radiation down my forearm into my left pinky finger ulnar distribution.

Medical history included none. No Known allergies. No COVID prior vaccination. Concomitant medication included VITAMIN C and multi vitamin. No other vaccine in four weeks. The patient experienced More pronounced pain from IM site, chills after more than 12 hrs, body malaise, all on 09Jan2021. 01:00 Outcome of events was recovering. No COVID tested post vaccination.

53 2021-01-23 injection site bleeding The injection site seemed inappropriately high in the shoulder/deltoid. No aspiration attempted. I ... Read more
Close
The injection site seemed inappropriately high in the shoulder/deltoid. No aspiration attempted. I had a dripping sweat occur at the five to fifteen minute range. There was a flushing sensation during this. After a few minutes, it all abaited. The bandaid was saturated with blood. My arm was never sore and I had zero symptoms after the initial reaction. I believe this injection was given intravascularly. I have not been able to find ANY information to address the effectiveness of this route if administration and I seriously fear that I am not covered.

Close
Body aches; Chills; Headache; Pain at injection site; poor appetite; fever; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable other healthcare professional (patient). A 53-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EL3249), intramuscular (left arm) on 11Jan2021 (16:45) at single dose for Covid-19 immunization. The patient received the first dose of COVID 19 vaccine (BNT162B2, lot number: EL1284) on 21Dec2020 (05:00 PM) intramuscular (left arm) for Covid-19 immunization. The patient's medical history included diabetic and heart disease; no known allergies. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient experienced body aches, chills, headache, pain at injection site, poor appetite, and fever on 12Jan2021. There was no treatment received for the adverse events. The outcome of events was recovering. The patient has not been tested for COVID-19 since the vaccination. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

He also is experiencing and continues to experience some numbness/tingling in his legs and arms. Two Saturdays following the vaccine he went to the ER and was diagnosed with pneumonia in both lungs. However, a fourth covid test was given and it was negative like the previous three tests.

53 2021-03-05 injection site pain I ate nothing that morning of the shot. The first day: I took the covid-19 vaccine Pfizer shot on T... Read more
Close
I ate nothing that morning of the shot. The first day: I took the covid-19 vaccine Pfizer shot on Thursday the 4th of March; there was pain at the injection site just as any other vaccine I have been administered during military service. After the shot I felt tied, and my left arm did hurt from the shot, I started to feel irritable (angry or even aggressive), my chest became tight and my heart rhyme felt somewhat off causing me to start coughing and sometimes uncontrollable to the point I could not catch my breath I thought about seeking medical attention but did not.. The second day: Pain in my left arm went away at the injection site, tiredness went away, and the feeling of irritable (angry or even aggressiveness) went away, tightness in my chest and coughing went away. I have been having a chronic pain in my left arm for about a year and after the shot the pain was gone I noticed that on the second day. I did notice my body temperature was up and down showing symptoms of histamine reaction but not out of control.

53 2021-03-30 shingles, rash I received the first dose of the Pfizer vaccine on 3/16 and did not feel any adverse effects until o... Read more
Close
I received the first dose of the Pfizer vaccine on 3/16 and did not feel any adverse effects until one week later. On 3/23 I started feeling a few twinges on my left side where my bra strap is normally, and then on 3/25 I noticed a rash in that same area. I thought it might be a reaction from the vaccine since it was on the same side as the injection site. But within a few days it was noticeably worse and painful. I went to urgent care on 3/27 and was diagnosed with shingles. I am now on antiviral medication and prednisone.

Received vaccine and refused to stay in observation area. Developed Tingling in throat and tightness in facial area drove back around building to entry point and sent to medical observation area. Wife and children present. No hives, rash, respiratory impact. VS 118/76 88 bpm, 98% Room Air, No external symptoms of reaction. Symptoms resolving over observation period of 45 minutes. Vital signs continued to be stable. Talkative and no distress noted. Medical Director MD consulted by phone and patient released. Close
Very sore arm within 12 hours of 2nd shot on Wednesday March 24th. Woke up the next day feeling "off" and irritated. By 9pm Thursday my entire body ached severely as if I had a very bad flu. By 11pm I had very severe cold & hot shakes and felt extremely nauseous until the next morning. I checked my temp every couple hours and never was I above 98.5 but, I felt extremely sick until about 48 hours after the 2nd shot. On Friday, and for the next 2-3 days, I felt fatigued as if I was recovering from the flu. Only a flu that was without fever or any respiratory issues. By Monday I felt normal again.
53 2021-04-01 injection site pain Last night, I was doing dishes and felt a brief, sharp pain at the injection site. Immediately afte... Read more
Close
Last night, I was doing dishes and felt a brief, sharp pain at the injection site. Immediately afterwards, I got a tingling sensation that went from my left cheek to elbow. It lasted a bit but wasn't very bad , considering some of the side effects I had heard of. Then, on April 2nd, I found that touching the injection site caused the same reaction, albeit not as bad. This occurred twice today. When I looked the symptoms up on the web, I didn't find any mention of this. However, Google seems to have seen something because before I could get the entire search term in, it completed for arm tingling. At this point, I decided to report it. Again, the reaction is very mild, but very odd.

53 2021-04-06 itchy skin Immediately after the shot , I felt arm get strangely itchy , then my left arm was very warm for a c... Read more
Close
Immediately after the shot , I felt arm get strangely itchy , then my left arm was very warm for a couple hours. I told the Dr there , they released me after 20 min , as there was no serious pain . After couple of days with Sore Arm pain , my left ribs area became a little sore and starting to have what felt like nerve jolts from left side of my Neck down my left arm. The Neck pain and nerve feeling got steadily worse over the next 3-4 days , on the 5th or 6th day the pain was so bad I could not move out of bed in the morning for over 2.5 hours. With a sudden move there was lightening bolt type pain shooting down left arm and right leg. Pain subsided over the next 3-4 days. I would say now it's 90% .

After my second dose, I have developed allergic reaction to peanuts. I ate Pad Thai which contained peanuts few days after my second dose and developed itch all over my body. I take Allegra for seasonal allergies, so I took it and the itch went away. Today I ate Protein Peanut Butter Dark Chocolate bars and again developed severe itch all over my body. I have eaten Pad Thai and the cereal bars many times before the vaccine and never had any issue.

Rash in my armpit it's kind of magenta, look little creepy in the center section of it; it's not terribly irritating, it's a little irritating but doesn't really itch; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer (patient). A 53-years-old male patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), via an unspecified route of administration in the left shoulder on 13Mar2021 (Lot Number: EN6207), at single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included allergy. At 10:43am retake vitals: pulse: 65, blood pressure: 120/80 and oxygen: 100% and client reports that all symptoms completely resolved. 53 2021-04-24 hives, itchy skin Ankles started itching like he had mosquito bites / itching was out of control; Hives on ankles, han... Read more
Close
Ankles started itching like he had mosquito bites / itching was out of control; Hives on ankles, hands, trunk, stomach, back, front, feet / hives all over; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer reporting on behalf of her husband. A 53 years old male patient received the first single dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot ER2613, expiry date Jul2021) on 05Apr2021 at around 16:00, in left arm, for COVID-19 immunisation. No other vaccines were given within 4 weeks. Medical history included cold sores. Concomitant medication included valaciclovir hydrochloride (VALTREX) 1 g, 2 tablets when felt cold sore coming on, for cold sores. The patient took Valtrex just once in a while when he got cold sores, since probably 7-8 years ago. On 05Apr2021 at around 19:00 patient ankles started itching like he had mosquito bites. Hives started on the patient's ankles on 05Apr2021, then spread a little on his hands and a little on his trunk. Throughout the night of 05Apr2021, hives started appearing on his trunk, his stomach a little bit and some on his back. Over the course of 06Apr2021 to 07Apr2021, the hives spread to the patient's front, back, hands and feet. The patient worked most of 06Apr2021 and 07Apr2021 and the hives and the itching continued to get worse. The patient had more hives on 06Apr2021 and on 07Apr2021 he had hives all over. The patient's whole body was filled with hives. By 07Apr2021 night, the patient's itching was out of control and he couldn't hardly stand it. The events required physician office visit (urgent care for hives on 07Apr2021) and also emergency room during the night of 07Apr2021 and again on 08Apr2021 morning at 06:00. Caller reported that she and the patient just got back from the emergency room. The patient was starting to itch again. He lasted about 4 hours after getting home last night, 07Apr2021, and then went back to emergency room on 08Apr2021 morning. Nothing had really helped the patient's itching and hives. The medications took a little of the edge off of the patient's itching. They gave the patient an IV at the emergency room visit on 08Apr2021, but he was starting to itch again. The patient received a prescription for prednisone from urgent care (he had to take 60 mg the first day, 60 mg the second day, and then taper down over 6 days). When the patient finally got the prescription for prednisone filled and the patient was finally able to take the prednisone, he was going crazy from the extreme itching. The patient hadn't eaten and ended up getting sick from the prednisone. First emergency room visit: the patient received a shot of diphenhydramine 50 mg at 11:33 PM and methylprednisolone sodium 125 mg at 11:36 PM on 07Apr2021. The emergency room gave the patient a prescription for doxepin 10 mg every night for 7 days to help the patient relax and so that he could sleep, but they were unable to have the prescription filled last night as the pharmacy was closed. The patient was given a dose of 10 mg of doxepin to go home with so that he could sleep. Second emergency room visit: the patient received diphenhydramine 50 mg injection at 7:54 AM, 20 mg of famotidine at 7:21 AM, 60 mg methylprednisolone at 7:19 AM, and a 500 mL bolus of sodium chloride 0.9% at 7:56 AM on 08Apr2021. The patient was sent home with prescriptions for hydroxyzine pamoate 50 mg, 1 capsule by mouth three times daily as needed for up to 5 days and famotidine 20 mg, 1 tablet by mouth twice daily for 5 days. Hydroxyzine, famotidine, diphenhydramine, methylprednisolone and doxepin had not really helped the patient's hives and itching. The patient was still trying to recover at the time of report. No follow up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

continued muscle pain; skin, hair was hurting, couldn't touch skin; muscular pain down to pelvis and knees aching; muscular pain down to pelvis and knees aching; diarrhea; chills; Fever; sweating; inner-skeletal pain; feeling of dry mouth; slight pain at left shoulder where the injection site was at; headache; Fatigue; weakness and dizziness; weakness and dizziness; sinus drainage; feels dehydrated; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer (patient). A 53-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration administered in arm left (left shoulder) on 30Mar2021 09:00 (Lot Number: ER8733) at age of 53 years old as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Patient's medical history (including any illness at time of vaccination) was none. Family medical history relevant to events: caller states he don't think so, his father had high blood pressure and diabetes. Concomitant medication included ibuprofen taken for tooth disorder at 600 mg every 8-12 hours, taking it probably a week before receiving the vaccine. No prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks). No events following prior vaccinations. No additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer Suspect. The patient experienced slight pain at left shoulder where the injection site was at on 30Mar2021, chills on 02Apr2021, fever on 02Apr2021, sweating on 02Apr2021, continued muscle pain on 03Apr2021, skin, hair was hurting, couldn't touch skin on 03Apr2021, muscular pain down to pelvis and knees aching on 03Apr2021, diarrhea on 03Apr2021, fatigue in 2021, headache in 2021, weakness and dizziness in 2021, sinus drainage in 2021, feels dehydrated in 2021. The patient was calling to report some long term, severe side effects. He received the Pfizer covid-19 vaccine on 30Mar2021. He didn't have anything then muscle pain for the first two and a half days, no reaction until on Friday 02Apr2021 he had extreme chills, fever, sweating, then that continued on to be muscle pain, his skin and hair were hurting, couldn't touch skin through Sunday 04Apr2021. It dissipated into muscular and inner-skeletal pain. He had muscular pain down to pelvis and knees and things would start aching. Now it was kind of letting up. It was the 4th day now and no one he knows who had gotten it had such a long term reaction to this. Clarified that he had slight pain at left shoulder where the injection site was at and that dissipated on Thursday 01Apr2021 and he had no pain anymore and no other side effects. On Friday 02Apr2021 afternoon when it went haywire and thought he may have to go to the hospital on Sunday 04Apr2021. He had diarrhea and almost had everything on the list except redness at the site injection. He also did not have swollen lymph nodes. He didn't think he needed to go to the hospital, he normally didn't get sick and hadn't been ill for years and this was why he wanted to report it because it seemed that it was pulling for along time. He had been sleeping and drinking a lot of liquids. Headache, joint pain, and diarrhea continued all the way through Monday 05Apr2021 and started to dissipate Monday evening. He had no nausea and vomiting. The muscular pain down to pelvis started Saturday 03Apr2021. His knee would ache and then that would stop and then his other knee would ache then stop. It was like it would transfer around lower part of body, and that dissipated late Monday 05Apr2021 night into Tuesday (06Apr2021). Now he had fatigue was tired and had sinus drainage. He felt dehydrated and couldn't seem to drink enough liquids to get the feeling of dry mouth out. The diarrhea, fatigue and the sinus drainage was still continuing and the other symptoms seem to have dissipated. He still felt so fatigued and didn't feel the other symptoms are there. He hoped they didn't return. It had stayed the same for the diarrhea, fatigue and sinus drainage and he was still tired. Later added he did have weakness and dizziness, but assumed it was fever and chills. Caller states he did have weakness and dizziness and Saturday 03Apr2021 and Sunday 04Apr2021 were the worst two for all of the symptoms at the same time. It had dissipated as of Monday 05Apr2021 evening. Outcome of weakness and dizziness: Caller initially confirmed it had dissipated as of Monday 05Apr2021. However, he later stated he was still experiencing slightness there. He still feels some weakness, and feels about 60% right now. He thought it would be a good idea to get vaccinated because he had family members that had contracted covid-19 and be less weary of the virus. He was hesitant now to get the second shot. He was taking ibuprofen because he had issues with a tooth. He was taking Benadryl for the sinus and hadn't taken it in 36 hours and hadn't taking anything else. He was already taking Ibuprofen for the tooth issue, but was also using it to relieve some of the symptoms and if it was indeed that he may have contracted something after that. He hadn't been to the doctor but for checks ups in years and years. Time of Onset (24-hour clock): Caller stated it started about 1-2 pm in the afternoon on Friday 02Apr2021 and came on very quickly. The events did not require a visit to emergency room or physician office. The outcome of slight pain at left shoulder where the injection site was at was recovered on 01Apr2021. The outcome of diarrhea, fatigue, sinus drainage was not recovered. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

54 2021-02-08 injection site pain Severe Injection site pain. Fever, Body Aches, Uncontrollable Shivering. Dizziness. On the first d... Read more
Close
Severe Injection site pain. Fever, Body Aches, Uncontrollable Shivering. Dizziness. On the first dose I got these Symptoms at 11:30pm then they subsided by 6:30 am with multiple doses of Tylenol. I was able to return to work the next day. The second night the symptoms returned around 11:00 and persisted until morning. They went away with more Tylenol and all but the injection site pain did not return. On the second dose I had the same symptoms The same night as injection. They did not go away with Tylenol, and continued through the entire next day. Fever never broke. Unable to go to work with fever over 100. All symptoms persisted through the next night until morning when fever finally broke, and I was able to go to work. That night the symptoms return overnight, but were gone in the morning, and all but the injection site pain did not return. It has been 5 weeks since the first injection, and two weeks since my second, and I still have injection site pain and weakness in both of my arms. It is not as severe as the first five days following injection, but still persistent and noticeable.

54 2021-03-23 hives, itchy skin In observation the patient began to experience urticaria, and had a history of anaphylaxis. He comp... Read more
Close
In observation the patient began to experience urticaria, and had a history of anaphylaxis. He complained of an itchy forehead, which we began to monitor. He then felt thickness of the base of the tongue, tingling of the lips. He was given an oral dose of 25mg of Bendryl. We began to monitor his pulse ox levels. He remained at 98-99 sat on room air. His heart rate ranged from 60-68. He then experienced more itching of the arms, and continued itching of the forehead, thickness of the tongue. A second oral dose of 25mg Benedryl was given. After continual monitoring for 45 minutes his symptoms began to subside. After another 15 minutes he felt his symptoms had resolved. His final pulse/ox reading was 99% with a pulse of 67. He was instructed to follow up with his PCP. He was also instructed to monitor himself for further symptoms. ER protocols given. He left on his own.

Close
Left vaccination facility at 1:10PM, March 7th, 2021. About 2 hours later, hives and rash appeared on my upper torso and top of both thighs. When I woke up the next day, the hives and rash covered everywhere except my head. I took a shower and it became hard to breath, my eyes were very light sensitive, nauseous, and very dizzy. I tried to make it back to my bed, but fell twice. The second time I fell I stayed on the ground for about 5 minutes. When I got up, everything was back to normal. I left soon after to the Hospital emergency room to get checked.

54 2021-04-20 itchy skin Patient presented to the vaccination observation area at 11:35. At 11:50 patient stated his tongue w... Read more
Close
Patient presented to the vaccination observation area at 11:35. At 11:50 patient stated his tongue was numbness and whole body feeling burning and itches. No rash noted on the skin. He requested Diphenhydramine, he refused the Epi-pen and PO 50mg Diphenhydramine was administered. Site Lead came over speak with patient. Site Lead spent 20 minutes educating and encouraging patient to take Epi-pen and the need to call 911 ambulance due to his symptoms. Pt refused the Epi pen and calling 911 and stated that his condition is not getting worse. VS is BP 170/100, P 62, RR 20, O2 99% Pt stated that his BP 170/100 is his baseline on BP medications. Pt agreed to stay in observation for longer. At 12:50pm, pt stated that his tongue numbness is getting better only the back of tongue feeling numbness and the whole body feeling burning resolved, only the hands and back of ankles are itches. VS has not changed BP 170/100, O2 98%, RR 22, P 61. At 1:15pm, pt stated that hands itches resolved, back ankles itches are still itches. Only R side of back of the tongue still numbness.L side tongue numbness resolved. VS BP 170/100, RR 22, O2 100%, P 61. At 1:30pm, pt stated that L side back ankle itches resolved, only R side of back ankle still a little itches. R side tongue still numbness but less than 15min. VS BP 170/100, RR 20, P 61, O2 98%. At 1:30pm, pt left observation area. Advised pt to take public transportation to go back to work or home instead of self drive due to pt had Diphenhydramine 50mg, pt stated that he will consider the options of public transportation. Pt instructed s/sx when to reach out to PCP or ED.

Close
Approximately 12 hours post vaccination employee reported hives consisting of raised, itchy whelps from their waist to their ears. Hives reported as moderate to severe - kept employee up all night due to severe itching. Employee reports no increased heart rate, no difficulty breathing or shortness of breath, no fever, no direct pain or redness aside from the hives a the injection site, no nausea no vomiting. Employee took a dose of Benadryl when hives started, this seemed to resolve about 50% of them by 8am the following morning, a second dose of Benadryl was taken at 8am 12/31/2020, and by 12pm 12/31/2020 the hives were gone.

55 2021-01-26 rash, itchy rash, hives Patient developed initial severe itchy rash that started on bilateral arms and webs of fingers three... Read more
Close
Patient developed initial severe itchy rash that started on bilateral arms and webs of fingers three days after initial dose. Immediately preceding onset of rash he had eaten cereal and milk. Within several minutes the rash had spread to his abdomen, chest, back and bilateral legs. He had swelling of the lips and tingling of lips. At this time he took three 25 mg Benadryl. He stated the lip swelling and tingling resolved however the left anterior leg to knee had a large, prurutic rash. This rash resolved with continuous Benadryl treatment for two days. He presented to clinic on 1/26/2021 with similiar rash that occurred in the morning after drinking coffee. He had diffuse pruritic rash on abdomen, back, bilateral arms and legs. Some wheals on right lower leg. He stated he had tingling of lips but no swelling was observed. He had continuous movements of scratching his arms and legs and moving moving his arms and legs with some contortion of facial expressions. He had taken three Benadryl prior to coming to clinic. He was given Pepcid 20 mg in office. Most of the rash resolved within 8 hours with minor bumps remaining on bilateral elbows which resolved after twelve hours.

A 55-year-old male patient received the second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number and expiry date were not reported), intramuscular in left arm on 17Jan2021 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 on Jan2021 via intramuscular. On 17Jan2021, the patient experienced nasal and sinus congestion, rash on chest and face, angioedema of lips and periorbital area and wheezing. The outcome of the events was not recovered. The patient received an OTC antihistamine and monitored the condition. Information on the batch/lot number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on a chronological association and known product safety profile, a causal relationship between event angioedema and BNT162B2 ((PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

2/2/2021- seen in Ed with c/o intermittent fever following 2nd dose. Redness to bilateral upper extremities, c/o some pain with urination, weak. V/S stable, afebrile in ED. Assess for infection. No significant abnormal labs (see below), hydrated and discharged. 2/4/2021- arrived in ED with c/o vomiting, seen earlier by PCP that day labs drawn. Shortly after arriving in the ED copious amouts of emesis noted, the patient went into full cardiac arrest and CPR was started. -Please see HPI above, in addition after intubation the patient coded again. More epinephrine and lidocaine were given. CPR was resumed. We did obtain ROSC and targeted temperature management was pursued. He is placed on a lidocaine drip and a right femoral central line was placed by myself. At this time, norepinephrine drip was initiated given his continued hypotension. Post intubation chest x-ray suggests possible abdominal pathology and once the patient was stabilized further, he was sent to the CT scanner where CT head without IV contrast and CT chest, abdomen and pelvis with IV contrast was obtained. He did lose pulses once in the radiology suite. This was brief. IV fluids were initiated and he received over 2 L of crystalloid therapy. He continued to be hypotensive in the emergency department and vasopressin was added. He also had a single dose of Neo-Synephrine and IV push fashion to help bring his blood pressure up. CT scan reveals probable bilateral aspiration pneumonia/pneumonitis and dilated loops of small bowel without a transition point and pneumatosis involving loops in the left upper quadrant. I did try to initiate consult with critical care and possible transfer, however he continued to be unstable and coded requiring CPR multiple times. He was given IV bicarbonate given his prolonged CPR state and pH. Ultimately, the family decided to make the patient comfort measures only given his critical illness. Shortly after making this decision he did pass away in the emergency department. RADIOLOGY DIAGNOSTIC - CHEST PORTABLE 02/04 2051 *** Report Impression - Status: SIGNED Entered: 02/04/2021 2059 IMPRESSION: 1. Findings highly suspicious for portal venous gas which can be seen in the setting of bowel ischemia. Consider CT for further evaluation and/or surgical consultation. 2. Endotracheal tube 3.7 cm above the carina. 3. Low lung volumes with mild patchy perihilar opacities. Final Report Signed by: M.D., Sign Date/Time: 02/04/2021 8:55 PM Impression By: MD CT SCAN - CT HEAD WO 02/04 2140 *** Report Impression - Status: SIGNED Entered: 02/04/2021 2200 IMPRESSION: Negative for acute intracranial process. No evidence of mass effect, acute hemorrhage or definite acute cortical infarct. Final Report Signed by: M.D., Sign Date/Time: 02/04/2021 9:57 PM Impression By: - MD CT SCAN - CT CHEST/ABD/PELVIS W 02/04 2140 *** Report Impression - Status: SIGNED Entered: 02/04/2021 2214 IMPRESSION: 1. Ill-defined patchy opacities within the bilateral upper lobes, right middle lobe, in consolidative opacities within bilateral lower lobes which could represent aspiration, and/or multifocal pneumonia. 2. Small right trace left pleural effusions. 3. Diffusely dilated small bowel without a transition point and mucosal hyperenhancement involving the colon with areas of pneumatosis involving loops of small bowel within the left upper quadrant and portal venous air consistent with hypoperfusion complex. There is a small caliber appearance of the aorta and a flattened appearance of the IVC is well. 4. Intravascular air within the IVC and bilateral iliac veins could be secondary to right femoral central lying injection. 5. Somewhat abnormal enhancement pattern of the kidneys with hypoenhancement of the medullary pyramids which may suggest hypoperfusion injury as well. 6. Probable nondisplaced rib fractures on the right at ribs 2 through

Close
4 days after vaccination, developed isolated RIGHT preauricular adenopathy. No other problems. No ear pain, sore throat, fever, or other evidence of URI. Has happened once before in entire life, and that was with fever and sore throat. After 16 hours of swelling and mild aching from swollen nodes, consumed Naprosyn 250mg 12 hours apart. 2 doses total. awoke the next morning with isolated, painless, 2 cm bullae on left abdomen, 3 cm bullae on left forearm, 1 cm reddened patch adjacent to arm bullae (suspected this area to also develop bullae). Discontinued Naprosyn. Abdominal bullae spontaneously drained. Reddened patch disappeared. 3 cm bullae persists but no growth or change. No new lesions, though right preauricular adenopathy slightly increased in swelling and tenderness.

Close
Approximately 10 minutes after 1st dose of Pfizer vaccination. Pt. was fanning himself, appeared diaphoretic with mask down. He flagged down nurse and reported feeling hot/lightheaded. NP asked for BP machine, instructed patient to take slow deep breaths. Pt. reported he felt like he may lose consciousness. His eyes rolled and he became white/pale and appeared to stop breathing. Code assist called; didn't respond to sternal rub, but raspy breathing, weak/rapid pulse palpated; immediately transferred to the ground level without falling, 2 person assist. 9-1-1 called, BP machine didn't immediately work. As soon as his head was low, his face became bright red and he regained consciousness. He was disoriented briefly but then able to answer questions/oriented. BP elevated, HR 80s. BS 257. No s/s anaphylaxis. Hx of syncope r/t blood draw. Wife present and report hx of DM, HTN, Palpitations. He denied CP/SOB or palpitations. He had eaten and took regular medicine the morning. Paramedic arrived and patient was transported to the nearest ER. Pt. was later discharged.

started to lose his vision; he couldn't see anything; Shot was painful; he started to get hot with the sweats; he started to get hot with the sweats; terrible headache; dizziness; nauseated; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 55-year-old male patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 12Mar2021 00:30 (lot number: ENG6199) (at age 55 years old) as single dose for covid-19 immunization administered in a pharmacy or drug store. The patient had no relevant medical history. No known allergies. The patient had no covid prior to vaccination and was not tested post vaccination. Concomitant medication included tramadol taken for numbing shot for tooth, start and stop date were not reported. No other vaccines received in four weeks. The patient experienced the following with his first dose of the Pfizer vaccine. Shot was painful and in about 15 to 20 minutes later everything felt fine. But by the time he and his wife drove out of town, he started to get HOT with the sweats, terrible headache, dizziness and started to lose his vision. He pulled over to let his wife drive and by the time he got out of the car he could barely navigate to the passenger side. They turned around and headed for the hospital, 8 min away, at this time he couldn't see anything, he was nauseated but knew the hospital was pretty close. During this whole time his heart rate never raced just kept and even beat. His breathing was also just fine. By the time they got into the parking lot his vision was slowly getting better, so they sat in the parking lot for 30 minutes with the air conditioner on as high as it could go. His wife read through the side effects, he was experiencing many on the list. They left without going in. Onset of the events was reported as 12Mar2021 12:45 AM. Treatment was not given for the events. The patient recovered from the event "shot was painful" on 12Mar2021; while recovered from the rest of the events on an unspecified date in Mar2021.

55 2021-04-07 bruising, injection site pain, injection site reaction I received the vaccine about two - three inches from the center of the muscle and in back of center ... Read more
Close
I received the vaccine about two - three inches from the center of the muscle and in back of center - it was more in back of deltoid than the front of my deltoid. When I first got the shot, I had a burning sensation from the site of needle to back of neck to behind my ear area. It felt like a burning aching feeling. My ear felt like it was clogged up and aching. I told the medical site about it and the doctor on site said that more likely they hit a nerve. My blood pressure was very elevated. They had me stay to be observed for 45 minutes. I went back to work. I still felt it at night. The next day, I started feeling up my neck and my collarbone and my left side of my face and my head - my face felt tight and my lip felt numb on the left side and I had a slight confusion too. I went to Emergency room. They did CAT Scan and exam. After that, I noticed it was going all the way down my arm, all the left side of my body to toes. It felt like numbness - like neuropathy type feeling. It felt like constant pain. I went to the Urgent Care and they gave me Prednisone steroid (5 days of it) 5 mg to help with inflammation. I took that for the five days. I started noticing a little black bruising on my body. After that, I went to the Urgent Care again and they gave me Naproxen and and Dr gave me more Naproxen to take. He took bloodwork, too. I went to the ER and I was still feeling sick and hot. They said it was anxiety. I am still going through it - I feel it on the spot where I got the shot - and on my neck and on my head and on my left eye and down on my legs a lot - some days are worse than others but not as bad as when I had the first symptoms.

55 2021-04-17 vaccination site pain A touch of fever about 12 hrs after injection; the area of injection (left arm) got sore for about 3... Read more
Close
A touch of fever about 12 hrs after injection; the area of injection (left arm) got sore for about 3 days and then it went away.; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 55-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection, Batch/Lot Number: ER8733), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 26Mar2021 02:30 as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included high blood pressure, early diabetes. Patient was not allergic to anything. Concomitant medications included metformin hydrochloride, amlodipine besilate, Olmesartan, atorvastatin calcium. The patient had not received any other vaccines prior to the COVID vaccine. On 26Mar2021 18:00 patient experienced a touch of fever about 12 hrs. after injection. Also, after about 24 hrs. the area of injection (left arm) got sore for about 3 days and then it went away. No treatment received for reported adverse event. The outcome of the events was resolved. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.
55 2021-04-18 rash Rash under both armpits Approximately 6 inch in diameter
55 2021-04-20 hives The patient had 2 emergency department visits for this problem. The first visit the patient present... Read more
Close
The patient had 2 emergency department visits for this problem. The first visit the patient presented with urticaria. The patient was treated with antihistamines (H1 and H2 blockers) and corticosteroids. He was discharged home on prednisone twice daily and over-the-counter Benadryl. He represented to the emergency department with worsening of symptoms. The urticaria were much more diffuse and the patient also had angioedema of the lips. There was no angioedema of the tongue or throat. The patient had no wheezing or shortness of breath. He was treated with H1 and H2 blockers again, IV corticosteroids and IM epinephrine. The symptoms improved and the patient was discharged on fexofenadine twice daily, famotidine twice daily, the prednisone was increased to daily and hydroxyzine as needed for breakthrough pruritus or rash.

55 2021-04-22 rash with redness Itchy red rash developed on multiple spots on the body. Started gradually several hours after shot.... Read more
Close
Itchy red rash developed on multiple spots on the body. Started gradually several hours after shot. No rash on arm where I had the shot. Affected areas were stomach, forehead, cheek, chin, inner thighs, legs, fingers. Rash was similar to poison ivy rash in appearance and discomfort. Peak of symptoms was 4-5 days after injection. All symptoms were gone by about day 12 after injection.
55 2021-04-22 skin warm Shoulder swelled and became sore. Eventually whole body became sore, weak, hot and sleepy. Developed... Read more

Shoulder swelled and became sore. Eventually whole body became sore, weak, hot and sleepy. Developed fever/chills 99.5. Headache all day. Cough for about two hours. Symptoms faded overnight. No treatment.
55 2021-04-23 injection site pain I had pain at injection site, mild night sweats, and increased tinnitus (I have had tinnitus for man... Read more
Close
I had pain at injection site, mild night sweats, and increased tinnitus (I have had tinnitus for many years) the night of / after the first and second shots (03/26/21 and 04/16/21) After the second shot, I had less pain at the injection site, mild body aches, and increased tinnitus the night of the second injection. However, the real reason I am reporting this is because after the second dose, the increased tinnitus continued intermittent, usually in the evenings. The tinnitus became especially pronounced on day 2 or 3, 4, 5 and day 8 - the ringing became so loud on the evening of day 2 that it seemed I was having trouble hearing the television. And on the evening of day 8 after the second dose, the tinnitus again became quite loud, with the additional symptom that external noises were annoying / irritated me. I have had constant tinnitus for at least 20 years, and it almost never bothers me (or is even noticeable.) However, the tinnitus symptoms after the second Pfizer shot were pronounced enough that I thought I would report it. Of course, I can't be sure the tinnitus symptoms - especially those at days 4, 5 and 8 - are indeed side effects of the second dose of the Pfizer vaccine, but since I had increased tinnitus symptoms the night after both the first and second Pfizer doses, it would seem to me to probably not be a coincidence.

Mild injection site pain; muscle and joint pain; muscle and joint pain; fatigue; severe diarrhea; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 55-years-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm Left on 26Feb2021 10:30 (Batch/Lot Number: EN6205) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included diabetes mellitus, high blood Pressure ,neoplasm malignant and depression. Known allergies included shellfish. Concomitant medication included acarbose taken for an unspecified indication, glipizide taken for an unspecified indication, lisinopril taken for an unspecified indication, metformin taken for an unspecified indication, metoprolol taken for an unspecified indication. On 27Feb2021 12.00 am the patient experienced mild injection site pain, muscle and joint pain , muscle and joint pain, fatigue and severe diarrhea. The events were considered as non-serious. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. There was no treatment received for the adverse events. The outcome of the events was recovering. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Soreness and some swelling at and below injection location, similar to a FLU vaccine. No sever or flu like symptoms. I took some Tylenol for the soreness at the injection site. Next soreness was reduced but there was still some swelling. I was able to do yard work with the left arm. There did not appear to be and reduction in usability of the arm.

He later developed a rash on the left foot and pus filled areas on both ankles. His physician prescribed triamcinolone 0.1% cream to be applied twice daily.

55 2021-04-28 injection site pain Upon second dose I have constant twitching at and around injection site of left upper arm, it is ver... Read more
Close
Upon second dose I have constant twitching at and around injection site of left upper arm, it is very disturbing and persists to this moment. I noticed it about 24 hours after the shot. I also have the totally normal soreness at the injection site that persists to this moment. I did have flu like symptoms (body aches, limb weakness arms and legs, malaise) on 4/28/21 from 1pm till 9pm but has resolved. The First shot I do not remember which arm, I think it was the left but cannot be certain, but I had no side effects at that time. I also have a very occasional twitch in my right upper arm that persists to this moment which is similar to the twitch in my left arm but is much much less severe and very infrequent. Note I have specifically nickel allergy and a number of other minor allergies. I also used to have benign fastulations that were random though my body which resolved and has not been an issued since 2017.
55 2021-05-07 redness, vaccination site pain, bruising Extreme fatigue; Back of knees were cramping; Small bruise marks; Upper right arm inside he could se... Read more
Close
Extreme fatigue; Back of knees were cramping; Small bruise marks; Upper right arm inside he could see all of his veins; Head rush; Felt like he was going to spazz out; Sweating; Diarrhea; Headache and pressure at his temples; His ears were ringing; Left arm pain from injection site; Drop foot; Legs went to sleep; Arms were roided out or supercharged/Forearms did not feel like his blood was right; Difficulty/pain breathing in the upper chest; Difficulty/pain breathing in the upper chest; Pretty big at the base of his left index finger, red spot; Pain in the right thumb base/Pain in base of right foot; He felt like he was going to die 5 times; Thought he was having a stroke; Heart rate would go up or be faint; Lost four pounds during this, and gained one back; Stiff right arm/Left thigh was stiff; Thrashing event; Heart rate went up; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 55-year-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection, Batch/Lot number was not reported, expiration date: 28Mar2021) via an unspecified route of administration on left arm 24Mar2021 10:00 at single dose for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included cytomegalovirus from on an unspecified date 2010 and Palpitations. The concomitant medications were not reported. The patient reported, he has gained back a pound and that he is starting on the road to recovery in the last week. Stiff right arm lasted the first and second week. It started the first day of when he got the shot. The next morning, he calls a thrashing event where he felt like his limbs would not work. They did work, but it felt like he needed to move them around. He was thrashing in bed and making the motion with his big joints, then getting into the small joints. It was his arms and legs. Over the course of like an hour, his heart rate went up to like 120. He does not qualify this as racing, but his heartrate is normally 60. This was several times over the course of the first week so it would have been around 04Apr2021 or 03Apr2021. Events occurred 9 days later, which is what he is considering this first week. His left arm was where he got the vaccine, but his right arm was stiff. He felt like he was going to die 5 times. He also had extreme fatigue. He never went to the emergency room. At this time, his glucose was high and his zinc was low. The doctor thinks the extreme fatigue was the antibodies reacted to the cytomegalovirus. He adds that the back of his knees was cramping in the first and second week. In the right arm, he had some small very small bruises. His forearms did not feel like his blood was right. He does not know how to describe it, but he has had metal slivers in his arm in the past and it felt like that, like an infection. He does not know how to describe it. He adds that in his upper right arm inside, he could see all of his veins, like a roadmap. He also had some other things, like his left side of his head rush, like it felt like blood was rushing from the top to left side of his brain. At dinner and meals he had several instances he could barely sit there, he felt like he was going to pass out or spazz out. His limbs felt like they were going to spazz out. In second week, he had several nights where he sweated a lot overnight. The second week into the third week, he did not have the thrashing stuff anymore but for pretty long his heart would go up a notch and/or the heart would be faint. He had diarrhea when he got up. It did not go up to 120, but maybe 80, Headache and pressure at his temples, ears ringing. Left arm pain from injection site. It started with a bang and really hurt. It was really sore and kind of spread into cramping. It was stiff and the source was the injection site. At work, he thought he was having a stroke. His left leg and thigh were stiff and spreading feeling. About 20 minutes after sitting, his legs did not work, and he collapsed. He had Drop foot when his legs got stiff. It took like a week to retrain his arm and leg, like he had a mini stroke. He did therapy for himself and retrained his arm to play guitar. He had a little bit of stiffness in his left arm that comes and goes, stiffness in his left thigh that comes and goes, and his ears are ringing a little bit and it comes and goes. He is not getting second vaccine. He took zinc per his doctor recommendation, but it did not go well. He felt like his arms were roided out or supercharged. He had difficulty/pain breathing in the upper chest, a pretty big at the base of his left index finger red spot like blood collection, and pain in the right thumb base. He had pain in the base of his right foot. Blood tests were in the second week. Glucose was high and he is hypoglycemic. Glucose 117 mg/dl (79-115 normal range), zinc 54 mcg/dl (60-120 normal range), CMV IGG AB >10 u/mL (positive is > or = 0.7 range). The outcome of the events was unknown.
55 2021-05-10 injection site pain I received my first COVID dose on March 31, 2021, exactly 40 days ago. The evening of this first dos... Read more
Close
I received my first COVID dose on March 31, 2021, exactly 40 days ago. The evening of this first dose, my arm became very sore, particularly the muscle exactly where the injection was given (left arm). No redness or rash or any visible issue. I know a sore arm could be expected for a couple or few days, but this has continued to linger; the muscle has continued to ache every day since, specifically when I exert it such as lifting an object like a book or water bottle, or extending my arm straight out away from my body. It feels like somebody has punched me in the arm there or a pulled muscle of sorts. (My second injection April 22 was same arm.) There is no pain when my arm is at rest, but even a slight exertion causes discomfort, and lifting anything more than a few ounces or stretching it far from my body causes pain, as does trying to do a single push up. My arm was 100 percent prior to the injection and I could do 50 pushups no problem; now my left arm doing a single push up.
55 2021-05-13 vaccination site pain the pain was shooting down to his heart; severe pain in his left shoulder after that second dose; in... Read more
Close
the pain was shooting down to his heart; severe pain in his left shoulder after that second dose; injection site pain; pain is around his arms/going on the top of his legs; back and wraps down to the heart; major pain up around his shoulders and around the back of neck; I have stomach problems, I am collapsed stomach; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). This 55-year-old male patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) in his left arm on 05Apr2021 at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included Arthritis, Sinus problem, Asthma, Bipolar disorder. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received first dose of BNT162B2 on unspecified date at age of 55 years old for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient experienced injection site pain, severe pain in his left shoulder after that second dose. Some major pain up around his shoulders and around the back of neck, his left side was worst. He said that the pain was shooting down to his heart. So he went to the hospital because he thought it was something to the heart. They tested him, they evaluated him but they ruled out anything that has to do with the heart. They checked his heart, he had a cardiac catheterization, and was ruled out, everything came out negative. So, he just got out of hospital and was still developing the pain and it's on his left side, it's on his right side (as reported). He called all his doctors, they had no answers for him, now he was still in a lot of pain in both of shoulders like he was saying his left side was still the worst, and it has not gone away and the pain is still shooting down around his heart and shooting down around the back of neck and now it's going on the top of his legs. He went to the bone doctor and he was getting an MRI done, because the doctors said nothing was torn in his arms or tissues. He stated the pain was around his arms, back and wraps down to the heart. He was in dire pain, 8.5/10 and had a feeling of it was related to the vaccine. He clarified the pain was in both shoulders and the left side was worse and that was the side he had his shot on. Patient stated he had stomach problems, he was collapsed stomach. The outcome of events was unknown. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.
55 2021-05-21 redness, skin peeling, cellulitis Cellulitis; Chills; scaling; his leg started leaking; redness; sweating; had a crack in his skin; Th... Read more
Close
Cellulitis; Chills; scaling; his leg started leaking; redness; sweating; had a crack in his skin; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient) from a Pfizer-sponsored program. A 56-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 intramuscular administered in arm left on 17Apr2021 (Lot Number: ER8737) at the age of 55-year-old as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. He was allergic to milk. He said it gave him sniffles and stuffs his nose but he drinks it anyways. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. His 2nd shot of the Pfizer COVID Vaccine tomorrow and was asking if the vaccine would just be as effective if he delays the shot a week or 2 later because he was getting treatment for cellulitis on 26Apr2021 and he knew that the side effects of the vaccine and treatment are similar and he does not want to get "double whammed". He has heard that the vaccine would still be effective if delayed for up to 60 days and would like to confirm that. He confirmed that he had cellulitis and chills but said none of that was from the shot. He said that if he got the second shot he was worried about them double teaming his immune system. He said he had athletes foot and had a crack in his skin in Apr2021, and it got into him that way. He said the chills were from the cellulitis. The caller said that the events started shortly after his shot, oddly enough. He said he went to the hospital. He said he was at work. He said he went to the doctor on 29Apr2021 for the chills a week or two before that. He said on 26Apr2021 his leg started leaking. He said he was on antibiotics and it was going down but he still had redness and scaling that he wasn't able to get rid of. He said he got them at the same time, the leaking, the chills started that night. He said he noticed the cellulitis in the morning and he let it go for a couple of days. He went to the doctor on Thursday. He should have gone earlier. He said no more winter coat in the sun. He said his wife and his roommate were sweating and he had a sweater on; he had it bad. He said he didn't remember the days but he was tested for a blood clot which was negative and they checked out his heart. He did not provide the result of them checking out his heart. He says any doctor who knows about cellulitis knows to check these things. He also says they checked his blood pressure and other things: see formal field. He said after the emergency room they sent him home and told him to follow up with his primary care provider and a podiatrist, which he has done. He says he saw his primary care provider the following Monday 03MAY2021 and the podiatrist he didn't see until Wednesday 05MAY2021. He says he was supposed to see both of them within 2 days but he couldn't get in. Those events resulted emergency room and physician office. The patient was not hospitalized. He said his family had skin problems like eczema and such but he said it not relevant. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures on 29Apr2021 which included blood pressure: 110/63, temperature: 97.2, pulse: 84, oxygen saturation: 99%, respiration: 16. Outcome of event cellulitis, chills, his leg started leaking, redness was recovering; of sweating was recovered in 2021, of other events was unknown.
