55 2021-05-25 rash, rash papular, itchy rash, hives After first dose of Pfizer vaccine, I had a skin rash on the backs of both hands; small "bumps" in v... Read more
Close
After first dose of Pfizer vaccine, I had a skin rash on the backs of both hands; small "bumps" in various isolated patches. These went on for about a week and a half but had gone away by the second dose. I used no product to control the itch for the first dose. The second dose was on 5/1/21, lot # EW0173, same provider. The rash is considerably worse after this dose. Now I am getting large "bumps" of various shapes that crop up all over my body, but usually disappear over the course of the day only to crop up at some other location. These are irregular shaped raised areas, itchy, sometimes in lines, sometimes clusters. Occasionally they are the tiny bumps like I got after the first dose. The larger "welts" are usually about the diameter of a dime, but irregular in shape. One of the more unique ones was like a worm shaped line, about 7 cm long but only 5mm wide or so. At any given moment I usually have 4 or so areas on my body, usually hands, arms, trunk or neck area, that last about 6-12 hours before disappearing and a new batch crops up somewhere else. I am using a topical Benydryl gel to control the itchiness and that is working very well, and makes any given spot disappear more quickly. It's nearly 4 weeks after dose #2 but it's not occurring less often like it did after the first dose yet. I am hoping this whole body reaction will eventually run its course and the rash goes away. One other detail: the Lisinopril I had been taking was new-- this could be a reaction to it as well. I started my first course of it at 10mg one week before the first dose. I saw no adverse reaction of any kind during that week. Then I got the first dose of vaccine and the hand rash began 2 days later. On April 30, I was switched to the final regular dose of Lisinopril of 20mg and the very next day got dose #2 of the vaccine. The new rash once again started a few days later and got worse over time. So could be associated with the Lisinopril but my sense it more likely the vaccine given the first week of the med had no reaction of any kind,
55 2021-05-31 rash papular tooth infection, skin papular lesions and dark circles around both eyes

Soreness at injection site; This is spontaneous report received from contactable consumer (patient). This 55-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, Lot number not provided), via an unknown route, on 16Feb2021 15:30 (at the age of 55-year-old) at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation, administered at Workplace clinic. No other vaccine was received in four weeks. Relevant medical history included aortic valve disease and ''carbapenem'' (as reported) allergies. Relevant concomitant medications included acetylsalicylic acid (ASPIRIN), simvastatin, metoprolol tartrate and multivitamin (unspecified). On 18Feb2021 at 07:00, the patient developed soreness at injection site. The event was reported as non-serious. Pre-vaccination and post-vaccination COVID tests were not performed. The patient was recovering from the event. No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.
55 2021-06-02 blister, shingles Developed lower back pain, sciatica and skin sensitivity in right hip and leg approximately 10 days ... Read more
Close
Developed lower back pain, sciatica and skin sensitivity in right hip and leg approximately 10 days after second dose. Managed pain with OTC medications, stretching and massage over ensuing week as symptoms worsened. Approximately nine days following onset of symptoms, began developing blisters in patches on lower right leg. Visited urgent care and confirmed shingles, which is now being treated with valacylovir and predinsone. Symptoms are abating. This is my third bout with shingles as an adult. There is no confirmed linkage to my COVID vaccinations but I thought I should report this as a possible vaccine reaction given the close proximity of shingles onset to my last COVID shot.

Prior to vaccination, patient was diagnosed with COVID-19. Can you contact me and let me know what can I do please. I been like this 30 days. Patient treated with Medroll 16 mg 2 a day. Since the vaccination, patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of the events was not recovered. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested
55 2021-06-07 shingles, blister Shingles to face/outbreak of Shingles; nerve pain to the right side of face and upper right teeth; u... Read more
Close
Shingles to face/outbreak of Shingles; nerve pain to the right side of face and upper right teeth; upper right teeth are still numb and throb; right side of head hurt; right eye was swollen and almost fully closed; blister; terrible sunburn top of head and entire right side of face; trigeminal neuralgia; additional pain to front upper teeth from center to the right side of mouth; some pain on right side of face above mouth/ lot of pain all to the right side of face/terrible pain right side of face; pain to front upper right tooth/upper teeth ached/terrible pain upper right side of teeth/upper right teeth are still numb and throb; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 55-years-old male patient received second dose of bnt162b2 (Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine, formulation: solution for injection, Batch/Lot number and Expiration date was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on 15Mar2021 (at the age of 55-years-old) as 2ND DOSE, SINGLE for covid-19 immunisation. The patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine, formulation: solution for injection, Batch/Lot number and Expiration date was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on 22Feb2021 as first dose single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Concomitant medication included methylprednisolone (MEDROL [METHYLPREDNISOLONE]) taken for; amoxicillin (AMOXICILLIN) and secukinumab (COSENTYX) taken for psoriasis. On an unspecified date, the patient experienced shingles to face/outbreak of shingles. On 14Apr2021, the patient experienced pain to front upper right tooth. The patient saw dentist and the tooth looked fine. On 17Apr2021, the patient had additional pain to front upper teeth from center to the right side of mouth and some pain on right side of face above mouth. On 18Apr2021, the patient saw three different dentists, and none found any issues with teeth. On 19Apr2021, the patient had terrible sunburn on top of head and entire right side of face, upper teeth ached, having more pain to the right side of my face and the dentist thought he had trigeminal neuralgia. On 20Apr2021, in the evening the patient was in a lot of pain all to the right side of face and contemplated going to the hospital but did not go. On 21Apr2021, the patient woke up in terrible pain (right side of face and upper right side of teeth) and right side of head hurt, right eye was swollen and almost fully closed, and a blister was visible. The patient reported that, he saw a Rheumatologist who diagnosed Shingles and he started taking Valtrex and Gabapentin. The patient also saw an ophthalmologist who prescribed an antibiotic eye drop. The patient reported that, she was in bad shape, which is evident in a picture she took by 23Apr2021. The patient saw an ENT who had sent him back to the ophthalmologist and he consulted with Rheumatologist. The patient reported that, ENT gave him a Medrol Steroid for six days and Amoxicillin. The patient had been suffering greatly since this began. On 10May2021, the patient's swelling has receded, but still had significant nerve pain to the right side of face and upper right teeth and upper right teeth are still numb and throb. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of herpes zoster, toothache, oral pain and eye swelling. Outcome of the events was unknown. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

Close
The day after the shot, the patient got the usual headaches, bodyaches, fatigue, arm soreness, such that it was difficult to raise his arm, nausea, dizziness and fatigue. That all resolved after two days. He then felt well for one week. Then, on May 29th, 9 days after vaccination, he got fever to 102, chills, fatigue, itchy vesicular whole body rash, headaches and bodyaches, such that, had he been working, he would have missed work for one week. He was seen, and put on Valacyclovir 1 gram tid * 1 week for probable recurrent varicella illness. Viral PCR was positive for VZV. He recovered over the course of 7 days.

For varicella, the patient did not have a rash in the affected dermatome; valacyclovir (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN), has been started. The events were reported as non-serious. The patient was recovering from the events.

Close
I did not experience any adverse symptoms with the first dose of Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine with the exception of injection site pain after the first dose that began on day 2 through day 5 or for 3 days. The first Pfizer-BioNTech dose was received on December 30, 2020, LOT EK5730. I would rate the pain as a 5 out of 10 on VAS on 12/31/20. Please note that I completed the same pretreatment protocol 1.5 hours prior to dosing with Pfizer-BioNTech of Diphenhydramine 25 mg plus Pepcid 20 mg for both COVID-19 doses. I elected to complete a self-administered pretreatment protocol due to a shellfish allergy and literature reports of anaphylaxis with COVID-19 mRNA vaccines in food allergy recipients. I did not experience any adverse symptoms on Saturday afternoon after receiving the second dose of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine at 4:45pm on 1/23/21. On Sunday morning 1/24/21, I awoke feeling "cold." I dressed warmly, but the feeling progressed to chills by 3pm. Malaise ensued around 1pm. I also experienced injection site pain on the morning of 1/24/21 beginning at 7am. The pain lasted until 1/25/21. I would rate the pain as a 5 out of 10 on VAS ON 1/24/21. I began to feel uncomfortable with malaise and chills at 6:15pm on 1/24/21 and self-administered one dose of OTC Aleve, Naproxen sodium 220mg plus one dose of Benadryl 25 mg. I began to feel better by 9pm on 1/24/21. I awoke on 1/25/21 without any symptoms or discomfort with the exception of some injection site pain (2 out of 10 on VAS). I have been asymptomatic since 1/26/21.

56 2021-03-03 redness, vaccination site pain I was symptom free when I went to bed four hours after vaccination. In the middle of that first nig... Read more
Close
I was symptom free when I went to bed four hours after vaccination. In the middle of that first night (03/02/21), I awoke with an overall body ache, which persisted through the next day. In the morning of the next day (03/03/21), I awoke with soreness at the vaccination site, tightness in my chest, and a swollen, red left ankle. The overall achiness and sore arm were understandable, but the chest tightness made we wonder if inflammation in the region persisted from my cardiac ablation in May 2020 and was aggravated by the covid vaccine. I have a Kardia home-test ECG monitor, and the results of the test continue to be "normal." As far as the ankle, an MRI in August 2020 determined that I had torn my peroneal brevis tendon. After six weeks in a walking boot, I began physical therapy and noticed that if I exerted myself too much that I would get swelling and soreness. Everything in my ankle was healed by October 2020, and I have been hiking / running four times a week since without incident. I did not injure myself before the vaccination, so it seems to much of a coincidence that inflammation returned to my previously injured ankle just hours after receiving the covid vaccine.

First injection - only a sore right deltoid (injection site). Fairly intense but only lasted 24 hours and easily alleviated by Tylenol. Second injection - Ringing in my ears - noticeable starting about 9pm the day of the second injection (3/11/21) and it's still going strong. Intensity of ringing has remained constant to date unfortunately. Headache was minor and on & off starting the night of the injection date and appear to still encounter them but intensity has been low. Taken Tylenol to alleviate symptom with success. Soreness at injection site - less intense on second shot than first but it lasted about 48 hours. The Tylenol I took for the headache seemed to help with the arm pain. On the day after the injection, my right latissimus dorsi (same side as shot) became sore but only for about 24 hours. Tiredness - didn't feel the exhaustion until about 9pm on the day of the injection. Exhaustion/tiredness set in more than expected so very low activity the day after and went to bed several hours earlier than normal. Still feeling tired but emerging from that as i'm starting to feel more energy come back.

56 2021-04-01 injection site pain 3-hours post-injection: pain at injection site. 12-hours post injection: generalized fatigue, pain a... Read more
Close
3-hours post-injection: pain at injection site. 12-hours post injection: generalized fatigue, pain and stiffness in hip and shoulder joints, reduced appetite. 24-hours post-injection: continued fatigue and joint pain, generalized body aches (including skin sensitivity and mouth pain) and headache. 36-hours post injection: continued tiredness and joint pain, slight weakness in legs, alternating episodes of feeling too hot/too cold (but no actual fever), no headache. 48-hours post injection: lessening of both the fatigue and joint discomfort, return of mild headache. No further temperature episodes, appetite returning. 72-hours post injection: lingering slight fatigue, slight pain at injection site, minor joint discomfort, mild headache. All side-effect symptoms are improving.

56 2021-04-03 itchy skin, hives On Thursday April 1, 10 days after the vaccine (1st shot) I began to experience itch hives all over... Read more
Close
On Thursday April 1, 10 days after the vaccine (1st shot) I began to experience itch hives all over my body. I took Benadryl at 2 pm and 8 pm to relieve the symptoms. It helped. At 7 am, morning of Friday April 2, I took Claritin to relieve symptoms but it was not effective. At 9:15 am, morning of Friday April 2, my lips and cheeks began to go numb, and it felt as if my throat and tongue were swelling. At 9:30 am. I checked in to the ER. They monitored my condition and indicated my blood pressure and oxygen levels were normal. At approximately 10:15 am, my mouth began to feel normal again. While at the ER, the doctor checked out my hives and gave me Prednisone. She also gave me a prescription for 4 days of Prednisone, 50 mg tablets, and advised to continue taking Benadryl to relieve symptoms. I have taken Prednisone once a day for past couple days and Benadryl 3 times a day. Hives are still present today Sunday April 4, 2021 but milder than previous days.[Not certain if this is important, but on day 3 and 4 after the vaccine, I reported dizziness on mobile app check-in. The dizziness went away by day 5. I had no other symptoms appear until day 10 reported here.

Patient describes his side effects like a mini Covid 19 reaction. The symptoms were very similar to the symptoms he had 4 days into his Covid-19 diagnosis. It was reported that on Friday (26Mar2021) he felt normal and was able to workout on Saturday (27Mar2021) as usual. The patient believes his antibodies are strong following his virus and then the 1st Pfizer vaccine dose. The patient doesn't think he had a fever, but he didn't have that with covid along with no loss of taste and smell. The patient was very grateful for the vaccine. Patient had no other vaccinations within 4 weeks prior vaccination. The patient underwent lab tests which included blood cholesterol and blood pressure whose results are reported as high on an unknown date. The outcome of the event double pneumonia was unknown, and for all other events it was recovered.

56 2021-04-20 hives ?Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine EUA The following morning after receiving my first vaccination, I ... Read more
Close
?Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine EUA The following morning after receiving my first vaccination, I woke up with a few small hives around various parts of my body. My arms, chest, back, and legs. As the day went on and I moved around, the hives disappeared. Before going to bed, I noticed that my left eye was mildly swollen. The next morning, I woke up and the hives returned. Again, after moving around, the hives went away. Later in the late afternoon and into the evening, I noticed that both of my eyes were swollen and so was my upper lip. I woke up and the hives returned, only one eye was swollen and my lip was swollen. By later in the afternoon, the hives and swelling had just about disappeared. The following morning, I was back to normal with no hives and no swelling around my eyes or lips.

Within 30 minutes of receiving vaccination started having minor nerve sensations at random places throughout body. The sensations (pins & needles, itching, crawling, tingling and minor energy zaps well below skin) continued regularly but were never severe. On April 10th I started taking. 1 tsp of L-glutamine Supplement which I have previously taken with no issues. Neurological paresthesia increased once I?ve started taking supplements. After about one week I made the connection and stopped. Symptoms decreased but have not ceased. Rather they went back to levels they were before taking the L glutamine.

56 2021-04-25 hives, rash with redness, rash, rash papular 2 weeks after his first COVID vaccine on 3/20/2021, patient developed a rash, located on the dorsal/... Read more
Close
2 weeks after his first COVID vaccine on 3/20/2021, patient developed a rash, located on the dorsal/lateral feet, legs and arms; red and bumpy but not itchy. He was seen on 4/9/2021 at which time he had small ~2-3 mm purplish macules and slightly elevated papules on the thighs, lower legs and very faint on the right flexor forearm. A biopsy of the skin was done on 4/9/2021 and he was treated with Triamcinolone 0.1% cream pending biopsy results. The patient had his second COVID vaccine on 4/10/2021 and patient reported his rash spreading on his arms on 4/12/2021. biopsy results returned on 4/14/2021 and showed urticarial hypersensitivity reaction. He was continued on Triamcinolone 0.1% cream and Zyrtec 10 mg po qhs and Claritin 10 mg po qam were started. He was seen on 4/21/2021 and exam showed: Arms and legs have small erythematous papules, monomorphic and less than 3 mm each, on the distal arms and legs. The most numerous are on the dorsal wrist and lateral feet bilaterally. His palms and soles are clear. The more proximal lesions present on the lower legs and forearms are not as erythematous and appear to be fading; previously affected area on the R flexor forearm at last visit is clear today. The ones on the thighs also appear to be fading with mostly post inflammatory hyperpigmentation remaining. The mid to low back, flanks and abdomen are clear except for two similar erythematous papules on the left flank He was continued on Triamcinolone 0.1% cream and Claritin 10 mg po qam; zyrtec was discontinued due to sleepiness. On 4/22/2021 and 4/23/2021 patient sent patient portal messages showing new linear purplish plaques developing. Labs were sent which were unremarkable. Felt to be dermatographism and zyrtec restarted at lower dose of 5 mg po qhs.

Close
LUQ Abdominal Pain: Patient reports that he was in his usual state of health until last week when he received his COVID 19 vaccination. He received 1st dose of Pfizer vaccination. Prior to this he was healthy. He reports 10 minutes after injection, he felt a knot/burning sensation in the LUQ of his abdomen. He states that it progressively worsened to the point where he couldn't sleep the following night. Over the weekend, he felt like he was improving. However, last night it was significantly uncomfortable. He feels an achiness/bruising sensation over his LUQ. He reports that there is a baseline discomfort but then it will become so bad that he has a hard time walking. He states that if he gets in a certain position he will feel improved but if he moves the wrong way it feels like it pinches. No changes with food. He reports decreased appetite. No fever, chills, nausea or vomiting. He had diarrhea x 1. No constipation.
56 2021-05-21 vaccination site pain Caller has previously been diagnosed with arthritis, fibromyalgia and acid reflux. On Sunday, 09 May... Read more
Close
Caller has previously been diagnosed with arthritis, fibromyalgia and acid reflux. On Sunday, 09 May 2021, at 4:00PM, at that time, all three activated at once; Caller has previously been diagnosed with arthritis, fibromyalgia and acid reflux. On Sunday, 09 May 2021, at 4:30PM, at that time, all three activated at once; Caller has previously been diagnosed with arthritis, fibromyalgia and acid reflux. On Sunday, 09 May 2021, at 4:30PM, at that time, all three activated at once; his arm pain became sever; Caller had pain at the injection site; He felt his arm shutting down from his shoulder to his fingers, becoming paralyzed; felt shaky inside; did not sleep at all; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (Patient) The 56-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (Solution for injection, Lot number unknown), via an intramuscular route of administration (standard 0.3mL according to patient) on 07May2021 at 02:30 PM (at the age of 56-years), for COVID-19 immunization. The patient had a family and medical history of hypertension but was not on any medications. He was on blood pressure medication (unspecified) but they took him off because he was doing fine. He had been diagnosed with arthritis, fibromyalgia and acid reflux. The patient was allergic to Tetracycline: His arm shutting down, and being paralyzed after taking tetracycline happened years ago and the paralysis was much more severe. They told him no more tetracycline for him, and he has not taken it since. He got a flu shot 26 years ago, and it put him in the hospital. He has not had a flu shot since. The patient did not receive any vaccines within 4 weeks prior vaccinations. Patient had no history of other previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine or additional vaccines administered on same date of vaccination Concomitant medications were not reported. After first dose on 07May2021, patient had a rough time from it and felt some pain in the injection site, right after he went down to rest and felt shaky inside. Shakiness occurred right after the injection, it was subtle and at 8:00 PM his arm pain became severe, as it went on, he did not sleep at all. Patient arm pain went through out Friday night, and into Saturday morning. His arm pain was gone by 5:00 AM on Saturday morning. He felt his arm shutting down from his shoulder to his fingers, becoming paralyzed. At 8:00 AM Saturday, the paralysis sub-sided partially and at 5 pm that day he was perfectly fine. On Sunday, 09May2021, at 4:00 PM, all three: arthritis, fibromyalgia and acid reflux activated at once with no warning. That morning he had no symptoms except from the arthritis pain. He made a VAERS report and that his doctor recommended taking Ibuprofen right after taking his second dose. Event did not require Emergency Room/ Physician Office visit. He was scheduled to receive the second dose on Friday 28May2021, but due to his doctor suggestion he would like to know if he can reschedule it for Thursday 27May2021. The outcome of the events of arm shutting down from his shoulder to his fingers, becoming paralyzed; his arm pain became severe; pain at the injection site; did not sleep at all was recovered on 08May2021, and events fibromyalgia and acid reflux on 11May2021, felt shaky inside was recovered on an unspecified date in May2021, while that of arthritis was unknown. Information on the lot/batch number had been requested.

Medical history included ongoing sciatica, back problems, stomach was sensitive, lower back pain, bone spurs down his spine. He was a medical marijuana patient, he had Shigella when he was a baby. He was 2 or 3 and almost died but came out of it; His mom had cancer from smoking, he got the worse flu sick of his life. His stomach was sensitive all of the time. If he was too happy or too nervous get upset. He can eat spicy food, not super hot, but he can eat anything and it doesn't go crazy. He has a little bit of a sensitive stomach sometimes. He can't take a multivitamin or supplements because he would get sick to his stomach, this was before the vaccine. He was getting that same sick feeling now that he would get if he was taking a multivitamin. He had his blood drawn a week before he had the vaccine to check his kidneys with the pills he is on. It was perfect and normal, and he has had nothing since then. In his 20s he had the flu vaccine, and he had never had the flu in his life. That year he got the worse flu sick of his life. He never got the flu vaccine or other vaccines after that. That was probably between 1987 to 1990. His folks passed away. He had been in the hospital when he was little.Concomitant medications included acetaminophen taken for back pain, sciatica from an unspecified start date and ongoing; nabumetone taken for sciatica, back pain from an unspecified start date and ongoing. The patient experienced he passed out for 2 days (medically significant) on Apr2021 with outcome of unknown, been sick pretty much everyday (non-serious) on 07Apr2021 22:00 with outcome of not recovered, not feeling good in his stomach (non-serious) on 07Apr2021 with outcome of not recovered, slept all day for several days (non-serious) on 08Apr2021 with outcome of unknown, responding strangely to people/but is still there and is so weird (non-serious) on 12Apr2021 with outcome of not recovered, his stomach was feeling sick and his body was hurting (non-serious) on 15Apr2021 with outcome of not recovered, his whole torso hurt and his stomach (non-serious) on 15Apr2021 with outcome of unknown, diarrhea (non-serious) on 12Apr2021 with outcome of not recovered, getting really irritable (non-serious) on 09Apr2021 with outcome of not recovered, he had no energy (non-serious) on 12Apr2021 with outcome of recovering, he was lethargic/weakness (asthenia) (non-serious) on 12Apr2021 with outcome of not recovered, dizzy (non-serious) on 10Apr2021 with outcome of not recovered, couple pains in the left chest area behind the breast (non-serious) on 17Apr2021 with outcome of not recovered, breathing hard (non-serious) on Apr2021 with outcome of not recovered, wouldn't feel good (non-serious) on Apr2021 with outcome of not recovered, arm started hurting where he got the shot (non-serious) on 08Apr2021 with outcome of not recovered, headache (non-serious) on Apr2021 with outcome of unknown, his arm was a little sore (non-serious) on 13Apr2021 with outcome of unknown, a fast heartbeat (non-serious) on Apr2021 with outcome of unknown, chills (non-serious) on Apr2021 with outcome of unknown. Patient got sick around 10:00 at night. He was supposed to get his second dose but he was so sick and they said lets give it a week. Then he talked to his doctor and he said to wait 2-3 weeks to make sure he is back to normal. So he is scheduled for the second dose next week at 6 weeks. He asked if it was okay that the shot was given in the sunlight. He stated that he saw that it was in an ice chest but the person had to walk it over to him 20 feet and deal with his sleeve for a second or two so it was in the sun. He said all that walking it was 100% in the sun and he has read that it should not be in the sun. He asked if this could have caused bacteria and caused his symptoms. He stated his doctor was only concerned about giving him antibiotics for bacteria if it was in the sun and if that was a problem. He just read from CDC, once mixed the vaccine can be left at room temp for 6 hours and mixed vaccine does not need to be protected from light. So it sounds like his first shot was good. He had gotten the shot at about 1430 in the afternoon. He was like he is going to get the shot and everything will be great. He didn't think there would be an effect. Then strangely enough at about 2200 he was about to eat dinner and he got to not feeling good in his stomach. It had been close to 8 hours. The next day he slept all day, got up and had coffee, and Saturday he was in the chair in the living room. He is never in the chair during the day because he works. He slept all day and all night and the next day. He was responding strangely to people, and he was in and out of it. He had the shot on Wednesday and then his stomach was feeling sick and his body was hurting. He has back pain anyway and bone spurs on his spine. He was telling his wife whatever pain he is normally in was enhanced. His whole torso hurt and his stomach. The following Monday he had diarrhea. Then he started getting really irritable and didn't want to talk and was impatient. He was lethargic and had no energy. That was the second week. By the end of the second week he had a couple pains in the left chest area behind the breast. He thought it was a heart attack, then thought it was just pain not a heart attack. Every time he wouldn't feel good he would start breathing hard. Once in a while he gets pain through his chest area. His stomach would start and he would breath hard every time he didn't feel good. The third week he was supposed to get the second shot. He called the department of health for New Mexico. The nurse called back and said not to do the shot that week but to wait a week. He rescheduled for a week later. By the third week he was still not feeling good and called the doctor. He asked about the pain in his chest 3 times and he said it seemed to be okay. His arm started hurting where he got the shot in the second week. He still had no energy and he told the doctor this. Patient started taking 2 extra Tylenol during the day for pain. Lately he has been good until one little thing and then all of a sudden his stomach is hurting and he is holding his stomach. He was good today, all he did was eat a cookie and he didn't get sick. He was worse for a little while in the first or second week, he was really bad. It came and went over the next 2 weeks and now it is coming and going less frequently. He slept through 2 or 3 days. Thursday, Friday, and then Saturday he was in and out. He woke up to take the garbage out on Friday then saw he already took it out and forgot it was out there. And it was Saturday. He was kind of out of it. When he would respond strangely he would respond with a question he just asked and someone answered. It is like brain fog or like he is on something. It started after the weekend, more on 12Apr2021. Once in a while he will forget a little something still, but just once in a while. He would walk and hold his rib cage with both arms when he was hurting. He wrote down that it felt like somebody had hit him in the back with a bat in the lower back. One day it was that bad. His back pain was on Thursday 15Apr2021. The pain now is not like where it hit him with the back. He has back pain every day but more than he used to. The sore like he was hit in the back pain was just the one day. He had diarrhea 12Apr2021, 13Apr2021, and 14Apr2021 then it left for probably a week. Then it came back last week one day. Instead of every day it was every 3 or 4 days. He has not had it in the last 4 days. He hopes it is done. He noticed any time he has salad or lettuce he feels bad in the morning so he stopped eating those. He felt irritable more when he started not feeling good. The last 5 days or so more towards the evening at 1800 or 1900 he starts not feeling good and gets irritated. His wife will ask him something and he gets really short and impatient. He felt irritable more when he started not feeling good. The last 5 days or so more towards the evening at 1800 or 1900 he starts not feeling good and gets irritated. His wife will ask him something and he gets really short and impatient. The irritable feeling started right away the Friday of the week he got the shot. He is still struggling some, it will come and go. Yesterday he was zonked. With having no energy it is a big thing. He has to do something instead of what he would be doing. He works all day and takes long orders and stuff. Now he does like one order when normally he did 10. One for him is a huge little sore so he will lay on his right side. His left arm still hurts like a pulling hurt from his neck to his arm. It has been every day from 13Apr2021. It is much better and he will move and it will relax a little bit. It was really weird. The whole time he held the phone with his left hand up until one second he moved his phone and it was the same pain. At night the left side where he had the injection pulls on his neck muscle coming from his arm. He was actually taking two Tylenol in the morning and two at night when he went to bed. With the pain he takes 2 during the day, 650mg each. He was just taking 500mg and then his wife said take these. It seems to have gotten a little better. He always took them 2 times a day and now he takes them 3 times a day. After the first dose he experienced difficulty breathing dizziness, weakness, a fast heartbeat, chills, nausea, headache, he passed out for 2 days and has been sick for 5 weeks. He started having some dizziness a couple of days later and reports, it's like I would stand up too quickly and get a head rush, that kind of dizzy feeling. He confirmed that his dizziness did not start until a couple of days after he received his first dose.

In the night, he was hot, shivering, and his temperature got up to 101. The patient's temperature was not so high this morning but that he still wasn't feeling himself. Their son was a vet and when her husband helps their son with the animals, he takes it to make sure he was clean. She clarified further it's the aspirin that's for body and aches. His doctor doesn't let him take any more than one tablet daily in case he gets cut, he could bleed. The patient takes the aspirin daily because both his dad and mom died of aneurysms so he was told to take an aspirin daily to make sure his arteries and everything are clean. It's a preventative to make sure he doesn't get any clogs and for the pain. She makes the comment unfortunately, their son that's 35 had to have 2 open heart surgeries. She and her husband have not been in contact with anyone. They have 3 small grandkids and a son with a history of open heart surgery. The wife reported that she and her husband live in a bubble. Close
Patient called 6/2/21 and stated that he had a blood clot on his leg and was asking if it was because of the covid vaccine that he had received on 5/18/21. Patient had self-diagnosed and at time of call, had not sought medical attention. Described as a huge, red spot on his thigh that was about the size of his hand. Located on right thigh, on top, almost by inner thigh. Stated appearance was red/rose colored, and was getting darker like a sunburn. Approximately 10 inches long and 4 inches wide. Hurts when he stands up, and rated a 5/10 for pain level. Vaccine administered 5/18/21 and symptoms appeared 5/29/21. Advised patient to seek medical care. Patient asked for contact numbers and provided Pfizer and CDC . Patient called Pfizer and representative stated that a report would be made. Noted that patient was prescribed anastrozole and this may cause venous thromboembolism in about 3% of patients. Patient was informed of this during a follow up call and advised to call prescriber, and again to seek medical attention. Prescriber was notified 6/2/21 in regards to the symptoms reported, and advised regarding possible adverse drug event.

56 2021-06-06 rash with redness, skin burning sensation, rash About 16 days after the 2nd shot, I began feeling very tired, fatigued, nauseous, and had a headache... Read more
Close
About 16 days after the 2nd shot, I began feeling very tired, fatigued, nauseous, and had a headache. About 18 days after the shot, I still had the same symptoms but also developed a red rash on my left upper bac, left arm, and left shin. The rash was painful and burned. When touched, I could feel the pain shoot through my nerves. I was seen by the PA referenced above, who treated it as shingles, but diagnosed it as a plant based reaction, as he could not be sure it was shingles. I was prescribed Mupirocin and valACYclovir HCI. I still had the fatigue and nausea for several days after starting the medication. Despite receiving my 2 shingles vaccinations in September and December of 2020, it appears the Pfizer vaccine may have triggered a mild case of shingles.

Moderate pain in left arm around injection site; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician, the patient. A 57-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE; Lot Number EK9231), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 07Jan2021 17:00 (at the age of 57-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included hypertension and allergy to penicillin. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Concomitant medication included lisinopril. The patient did not receive any other vaccine within 4 weeks prior to the vaccination. On 07Jan2021 23:00, the patient experienced moderate pain in left arm around injection site. The patient did not receive any treatment for the event. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of the event, moderate pain in left arm around injection site, was recovering.

patient's left arm (injection site) got very sore and painful and it was difficult to lift; patient's left arm (injection site) got very sore and painful and it was difficult to lift; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable pharmacist (patient). A 57-year-old male received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot number: EL3248), via intramuscular route of administration on 13Jan2021 at 19:00 at a single dose on the left arm for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. On 13Jan2021, after the vaccination, the patient's left arm (injection site) got very sore and painful and it was difficult to lift the next day (14Jan2021). The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of the events was recovered from an unspecified date. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Close
Received the 1st dose at around 5pm on 1/21/21 - No immediate reaction. Slight soreness in right arm prior to going to bed that night. Next morning, 1/22/21, whole right shoulder became very tight and rigid. Took one Advil/Tylenol for symptomatic relief. Around 5 pm on 1/22/21, started getting body aches and chills, took an Advil/Tylenol for symptomatic relief. Took another set of Advil/Tylenol prior to going to bed at 11:30 pm on 1/22/21. All well the next day and thereafter.

57 2021-02-10 bruising On January 8, I started having a cramping feeling in my right calf. It went on throughout the day ... Read more
Close
On January 8, I started having a cramping feeling in my right calf. It went on throughout the day without a event. I woke up the next morning, and the crap was worse. I ran some errands and came home and then looked at my calf of my leg and it was twice the size as my other leg. I had four spots of bruising from ankle to knee. I immediately went to the emergency room. I was hospitalized and had bloodwork and an MRI done which showed that I had a DVT and a pulmonary embolus in my right lung. I was hospitalized for two days on blood thinners. I had no shortness of breath or heart problems during this time. I was then released from the hospital on blood thinners which I have to take for the next six months.

shortness of breath; bad headaches; chest pain; rash on his neck and behind his ears; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 57-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number N5318), via an unspecified route of administration on 27Jan2021 as single dose for covid-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient experienced shortness of breath, bad headaches, chest pain and rash on his neck and behind his ears, all on an unspecified date in 2021. The events were all serious as they involved hospitalization from 02Feb2021 to 03Feb2021. Details were as follows: patient received the first dose of the vaccine on 27Jan2021; he had a lot of bad side effects and went to the hospital: shortness of breath, bad headaches, chest pain, rash on his neck and behind his ears. All this happened a few days after receiving the vaccine. He had an appointment with his cardiologist and he will have a cardiac catheter placed on 19Feb2021. The second dose of the vaccine was scheduled for 18Feb2021. The outcome of the events were unknown.

57 2021-03-15 redness Got first vaccine 22Dec2020. After second vaccine on 01Feb2021.; Got first vaccine 22Dec2020. After ... Read more
Close
Got first vaccine 22Dec2020. After second vaccine on 01Feb2021.; Got first vaccine 22Dec2020. After second vaccine on 01Feb2021.; my hands burn all the time, at times like tonite bad enough that they keep me awake; the hands get swollen and tight to close everyday; the hands get swollen and tight to close everyday; inflammation; thesymptoms have been getting worse; red nodular areas; nodular areas/distinct nodule at the proximal ulnar aspect of my Left 4th finger; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Physician, the patient. This is the second of two reports. The reporter describes events following both vaccinations in a vaccine series. This report is for those events which occurred following the second vaccination. A 57-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, Lot number EL3249), intramuscularly on 01Feb2021 (at the age of 57-years-old) as a single dose in the right arm for COVID-19 vaccination. Medical history included benign prostatic hyperplasia from an unknown date. The patient's historical vaccinations included the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, Lot number EJ1685) on 22Dec2020 after which he experienced inflammation, joint pain and burning sensation in the joints. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. The vaccination was administered at a hospital. Concomitant medications included acetaminophen (TYLENOL), tamulosin (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN) and metoprolol (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN) all from unspecified dates and for unknown indication. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. Per the reporting physician, he got his first vaccine on 22Dec2020. His MCP and PIP joints and SI joints started burning close to 3rd week in Jan2021. He had some minor SI pains intermittently before but none with hands. Continued hurting enough that he started taking Osteobiflex and fish oil and more tylenol for inflammation. After second vaccine on 01Feb2021 the symptoms he experienced after the first dose have been getting worse. He mentioned that his hands burn all the time, at times like tonight bad enough that they keep him awake. He has red nodular areas on some of his knuckles and a distinct nodule at the proximal ulnar aspect of my left 4th finger PIP that is uniformly erythematous. Not all knuckles have the same degree of burning, but all including thumbs have it. The SI joint pain is more variable and at time does not bother him, but the hands get swollen and tight to close everyday. He plans to start some prednisone tomorrow due to the progression of the burning. The clinical outcomes of the events burning sensation in joints worsened, swelling of hands, stiffness joints, inflammation, condition worsended, erythema, nodule on extremity were reported as not recovered. The outcomes of inappropriate schedule of vaccine administration and off label use were unknown. It was also reported that since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19.; Sender's Comments: Linked Report(s) : US-PFIZER INC-2021154881 Same patient, same drug, different AE, different dose of vaccine.

57 2021-03-27 redness One week after the vaccine the arm was very red and looked infected. He went to the doctor and was g... Read more
Close
One week after the vaccine the arm was very red and looked infected. He went to the doctor and was given Amoxicillin. But two days later he was feeling so ill he was in bed all day and had a horrible headache. He went back to the doctor 3-26. The doctor cut his arm open, drained it, flushed it and gave him an antibiotic shot in the rear end. He also prescribed Doxycycline and Linezolid because he believes its a MRSA infection. He did swab it but we don't have the results back yet. The wound is not as red today and my husband is feeling better. Should he get the second vaccine? the doctor said this was the second patient he saw that day with the same infection at the vaccine site. I received my vaccine the same time and had zero issues. The doctor thought maybe his arm was not sufficiently alcohol swabbed but I know he was swabbed as was I as we were in the same room. He has severe asthma so we wanted the protection from the Covid vaccine but want to know if it is safe to get the second vaccine? I have taken photos each day so I can share what his arm has looked like

My face became very red as if my face had the color of sunburn. My skin color is normally farely pale. My forehead and upper cheeks also developed small red spots. The spots and redness reduced to close to normal after approx 90 mins. I did not report this reaction to anyone. I was also extremely tired most of the day of the vaccine. I felt fine the next day and had no redness on my face.
57 2021-04-17 redness, rash small peripheral right lower lobe pulmonary embolism; anaphylaxis; whole body rash and erythema; who... Read more
Close
small peripheral right lower lobe pulmonary embolism; anaphylaxis; whole body rash and erythema; whole body rash and erythema; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable physician. A 57-year-old male patient received BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: UNKNOWN), via an unspecified route of administration on 01Mar2021 (at the age of 57-year-old) as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included joint pain and ongoing 45-packs per year smoker. The patient did not have any allergies to medications, food, or other products. Concomitant medications included salbutamol (ALBUTEROL), hydroxyzine (manufacturer unknown) and diclofenac sodium (manufacturer unknown). The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The physician reported, "patient had anaphylaxis and whole-body rash and erythema on separate hospitalization (I was not involved for this but reviewed photos and this was reportedly attributed to the vaccine; I'm uncertain if that event was reported). On hospitalization, the patient was with small peripheral right lower lobe pulmonary embolism on a CT PE (CT scan for Pulmonary Embolus). Patient is an active smoker. No other obvious cause." As a result of the adverse events (unspecified), the patient was hospitalized for one day. The start date of the events was on 29Mar2021. The patient was treated with apixaban (for pulmonary embolism). The clinical outcome of "anaphylaxis and whole-body rash and erythema" and "small peripheral right lower lobe pulmonary embolism" was resolving. The lot number for the vaccine, BNT162b2, was not provided and will be requested during follow-up.; Sender's Comments: Based on temporal association, a possible contributory role of BNT162B2 cannot be excluded for events pulmonary embolism, anaphylactic reaction and associated generalized rash and generalized erythema. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

I reported in sick to work and went back to bed for 4 hours approximately. I felt bad all day even as I went to bed.(chills and very fatigued). I tried to keep very warm and took Tylenol PM to sleep. 100% recovery 1 day later

The patient's medical history included 11 years post kidney transplant remission, Non hodgkins lymphoma. The patient's concomitant medications included sodium bicarbonate, gabapentin, morniflumate (FLOMAX), and clarithromycin (CLARITIN), all taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; Lot Number: EN6202), administered in right arm on 08Mar2021 12:30 PM for COVID-19 immunization. The facility type vaccine was Public Health Department. The patient had no other vaccine in four weeks. The patient had no COVID prior vaccination and was tested for COVID post vaccination. On 01Apr2021 at 12:00 (4 days after the second shot), the patient broke out in full body rash and hives servers. All over getting worse. The events resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, Emergency room/department or urgent care, hospitalization. The patient was hospitalized due to the events for 5 days. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included nasal swab: negative on 08Apr2021. Patient reported that by Saturday the rash had spread to cover his entire foot to include his toes and heels. He stated he feet began to burn. He also stated the rash to his hands got worse; minor itching to the areas. Seen on 04/26/21 at 11:28 am. On exam today patient's rash is not blanchable. He has rash like areas to his upper and lower legs, hands, upper arms, feet. The rash is different in appearance- some areas are round red circles with a white center, some areas are thick red patches, and some areas are small red bumps. Patient reports that areas that experience friction itch more (like the tops of his feet from rubbing on his shoes). Patient given 50 mg diphenhydramine (oral) at 12:00 pm. At 1:50 pm patient reports the itching has lessened with the medication but does not wish to continue to take. Have noted adverse reaction in patient's medical record.

Medical history included Acute Idiopathic Pancreatitis. Concomitant medications included Centrum Silver multivitamin and ademetionine (SAM-E). The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 (Pfizer- BioNTech COVID 19, Lot Number: ER2613), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm on 26Mar2021 13:15 (at the age of 57-years-old) as single dose for Covid-19 immunization. The patient was hospitalized for 3days from 21Apr2021 to 24Apr2021. AHRF (Acute hypoxemic respiratory failure); Acute hypoxemic respiratory failure from COVID; AHRF secondary to Influenza B exacerbating PAH (pulmonary arterial hypertension),; COVID-19 pneumonia; COVID 19/COVID-19 pneumonia; COVID 19; Volume overload; PAH with baseline PAH [Influenza B virus infection]; Worsening MR (mitral regurgitation) [Mitral regurgitation]; Steroid induced diabetes [Diabetes steroid-induced]; Lower extremity edema, 2+ pitting edema, to knees. 1+ dependent edema at thighs [Oedema peripheral]; Weight slowly coming down, weight up 4 lbs [Weight fluctuation]; Rash [Rash]; Fever, temperature 101.1 °F [Fever]; Diarrhea; Leg healing [Leg discomfort]; This is a solicited report received on 31Mar2021 from a non-contactable consumer via pharmacy. This 57-year-old, male patient began therapy with treprostinil diolamin (ORENITRAM, reported as treprostinil diethanolamine, Extended release tablet), on 01Aug2019 for primary pulmonary arterial hypertension. The patient was supplied with Orenitram unspecified dose (lot# 2101810, Expiration Date: 31Jan2023), 0.25mg, 1mg (lot# 2101648, Expiration Date: 31Jan2021), and 0.125mg (lot# 2101646, Expiration Date: 31Jan2021) and the current dose was reported as 3.875mg (lot# 2101647, Expiration Date: 30Jan2022), via oral (PO) route, every eight hours (q8h); received BNT162B2 on 24Feb2021 at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation; methylprednisolone (MEDROL, 16 mg tablet), orally at 16 mg, 4x/day for an unknown indication; nifedipine, with unknown date, route of administration and dose for Hypertension. Concomitant medications included: ambrisentan (LETAIRIS) and sildenafil citrate (REVATIO OD), ergocalciferol, digoxin (LANOXIN), epinephrine (EPIPEN Solution), escitalopram oxalate (LEXAPRO), folic acid (FOLVITE), hydroxychloroquine sulfate (PLAQUENIL), all ongoing, famotidine (PEPCID), unknown date to 04 on an unspecified date in 2021, furosemide (LASIX), 04 on an unspecified date in 2021, spironolactone (ALDACTONE), apixaban (ELIQUIS). Additional concomitant medications included: Citracal + d (calcium citrate, ergocalciferol, Tablet), 315-250 mg, ongoing. Relevant medical history included: systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) (on CPAP), Continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP), hypercalcemia, chronically high peripheral artery disease (PAD), hypertension, multifactorial stable SOB (shortness of breath), Pulmonary arterial hypertension, Peripheral arterial occlusive disease, all ongoing, calcium deficiency, and Patient's family history included: COVID-19 (brother positive). The patient experienced COVID 19 on 23Mar2021 (hospitalized, medically significant), COVID-19 pneumonia (hospitalized, medically significant) on 06Apr2021, AHRF (Acute hypoxemic respiratory failure) from COVID on 16Apr2021 (hospitalized, medically significant), AHRF secondary to Influenza B exacerbating PAH (pulmonary arterial hypertension) on 16Apr2021 (hospitalized, medically significant), PAH with baseline PAH [Influenza B virus infection] on 16Apr2021 (medically significant), Worsening MR (mitral regurgitation) [Mitral regurgitation] on 16Apr2021, Steroid induced diabetes [Diabetes steroid-induced] on 16Apr2021, Lower extremity edema, 2+ pitting edema, to knees. 1+ dependent edema at thighs [Oedema peripheral] on 16Apr2021, Weight slowly coming down, weight up 4 lbs [Weight fluctuation] on 16Apr2021, Rash on 16Apr2021, Fever, temperature 101.1 °F [Fever] on 16Apr2021, Diarrhea on 16Apr2021, Leg healing [Leg discomfort] on 16Apr2021, Volume overload on an unspecified date. On 23Mar2021, the patient experienced event COVID-19 (hospitalization, medically significant). On 06Apr2021, the patient had COVID-19 pneumonia (medically significant and hospitalized). On 06Apr2021, 1 year 8 months 6 days after initiating PO Orenitram, the patient was hospitalized due to pneumonia and remained hospitalized at the time of reporting. The patient was also hospitalized in 23Mar2021 for COVID. Since 06Apr2021, the patient remained hospitalized due to COVID. On 16Apr2021, the patient had acute hypoxemic respiratory failure (AHRF) from COVID, AHRF secondary to Influenza B exacerbating PAH (pulmonary arterial hypertension), AHRF secondary to Flu B and PAH with baseline PAH (acute respiratory failure, hospitalized, medically significant), pulmonary hypertension (pHTN) exacerbation, AHRF (acute hypoxemic respiratory failure) secondary to influenza B exacerbating PAH, pHTN treated with steroids as though to be flare due to lupus (pulmonary arterial hypertension, hospitalized and medically significant), AHRF secondary to Flu B and PAH with baseline PAH (influenza, hospitalized), volume overload (fluid overload, hospitalized). On 16Apr2021, 1 year 8 months 16 days after initiating PO Orenitram, the patient was hospitalised due to acute hypoxemic respiratory failure (AHRF) from COVID and for AHRF secondary to influenza B exacerbating PAH, then transferred to the other hospital with volume overload and diuresis. The patient was presented with volume overload and needed oxygen requirement (none needed at home prior to both hospitalizations). The patient's breathing and oxygen were improved with diuresis. Patient's pulmonary hypertension was treated with steroids as though to be flare due to lupus. Patient was given intravenous (IV) solumedrol (25 mg in AM and 16 mg in PM) as per the discussion with rheumatology and pulmonary hypertension cardiology with improvement in oxygen status. On 24Apr2021, the patient relevant diagnostic and laboratory test included: complete blood count (CBC) WBC (white blood count) 4.79, RBC (Red blood cell count) 3.31, Hgb (hemoglobin) 8.4, Plt (Platelet count) 146. Comprehensive metabolic panel (CMP) Na (sodium) 141, K (potassium) 4.1, Blood urea nitrogen (BUN) 39, Creatinine 1.68, glucose 90. On 25Apr2021, the patient had relevant diagnostic and laboratory test included WBC 5.51, RBC 3.24, Hgb 8.2, Plt 159. Na 141, K 4.4, BUN 39, Creatinine 1.59, glucose 117. On 26Apr2021, the patient had relevant diagnostic and laboratory test included WBC 5.41, RBC 3.30, hgb 8.3, Plt 159. Na 141, K 4.4, BUN 37, creatinine 1.54, and glucose 90. The patient was discharged on 26Apr2021. Patient's physical exam at the time of discharge showed pulse 65 bpm, respiratory rate 18 per minute, blood pressure (BP) 138/78 mmHg, temperature 36.5 °C and weight was 90.9 kg. The patient was breathing comfortably in no distress on 2 Litre nasal cannula (NC). Minimal crackles appreciated in the morning posteriorly. The patient had 2+ pitting edema, to knees 1+ dependent edema at thighs and edema unchanged but overall leg size decreased. Continues to be pitting but improved on the day of discharge. Patient's discharge diagnosis pulmonary hypertension exacerbation. Patient's diuretics were increased from 40 mg daily to 60 mg daily and may needed more diuretics. Discharge medications included: Protonix (pantoprazole), Demadex (torsemide), Medrol (methylprednisolone), Citracal + d (calcium citrate, ergocalciferol), Lanoxin (digoxin), Epipen (epinephrine), Lexapro (escitalopram oxalate), Folvite (folic acid), Plaquenil (hydroxychloroquine sulfate). Patient's medications of Pepcid, Lasix, and Aldactone were stopped after discharge from the hospital. The patient was instructed to take pantoprazole 40 mg daily while on steroids and when steroids tapered, he had to discontinue it in future and would stop pantoprazole and resume taking home dose of famotidine. Patient was on nifedipine at home and physician thought to be the contributing factor to lower extremity edema so stopped taking the nifedipine in house. It was reported that steroid induced the diabetes. It was reported that the patient needs transesophageal echocardiogram (TEE) due to had worsening MR (mitral regurgitation) but not agreeable at that time. The patient tried ethacrynic acid 50 mg daily but felt it was not making a difference with his weight. The patient went back on the Bumex (bumetanide) on Friday. Patient's weight slowly coming down to see doing good later on Bumex, his rash subsiding and leg was healing. Patient's weight was stable at 155 lbs and had multifactorial stable shortness of breath (SOB). Patient's weight was above baseline and needed more diuretics. Patient had been in touch with his COVID positive brother who was symptomatic and refused to be covid testing quarantining at that time. On 24Feb2021, the patient got his first dose of COVID-19 vaccine and his temperature was 101.1 °F. The patient would take Tylenol (paracetamol) and monitor if fever persists to 48 hours he would go to the urgent care. Patient was started on Eliquis and felt much better and no longer to had temperatures and diarrhea. On an 21Apr2021, the patient had right heart catheterization which revealed moderate pulmonary hypertension with right atrium (RA) 7, right ventricle (RV) 12, pressure wave (PW) 15, PA 62/ 25/40, PA saturation 63 %, CO 7, CI 3.52. Patient had chronically high PAD's and could not take metolazone secondary to hypercalcemia and pending admission for colonoscopy with the physician. Patient reminded multiple times by physician for getting a COVID swab. The patient also had increased 4 lb weight since discharge from the hospital. Action taken with PO Orenitram dose due to the event of COVID-19 pneumonia was updated to dose decreased and for the events of acute respiratory failure, pulmonary arterial hypertension, influenza, fluid overload, mitral valve incompetence, steroid diabetes, oedema peripheral, weight fluctuation, rash, pyrexia, diarrhoea and limb discomfort was not reported. Action taken with nifedipine, and Medrol dose for the events of COVID-19 pneumonia, acute respiratory failure, pulmonary arterial hypertension, influenza, fluid overload, mitral valve incompetence, steroid diabetes, oedema peripheral, weight fluctuation, rash, pyrexia diarrhoea and limb discomfort was not reported. Action taken with COVID-19 Vaccine was not applicable. The outcome of the events of rash and limb discomfort was recovering. The outcome of the events of pyrexia and diarrhoea was recovered on an unreported date in 2021. The outcome of the other events was unknown. The reporter's assessment of the causal relationship of the event with the suspect products was not provided at the time of this report. Since no determination has been received, the case is managed based on the company causality assessment. Case Comment/Senders Comment: The company has assessed the serious adverse events of COVID-19 pneumonia, acute respiratory failure, pulmonary arterial hypertension, influenza, fluid overload, mitral valve incompetence, and steroid diabetes as not related to Orenitram. The event of COVID-19 pneumonia was related to the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 pandemic, and the event influenza was related to seasonal Influenza B. The event acute respiratory failure was likely related to acute influenza, but was also possibly impacted by pulmonary insult from COVID-19 pneumonia, and underlying lupus associated with PAH. The event pulmonary arterial hypertension was likely an exacerbation of the underlying PAH due to the concurrent infections. The event mitral valve incompetence and fluid overload were likely related to cardiac dysfunction associated with the underlying chronic and progressive PAH. The event steroid diabetes was likely related to co-suspect medication Medrol, which was used as treatment for the lupus, although co-suspect medication nifedipine was possibly contributory to the event in view of its safety profile and as such cannot be excluded. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected. Information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.; Sender's Comments: Based on the information currently available,The casual association between the reported events and suspected vaccine BNT162B2 cannot be completely excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.
57 2021-05-21 rash This is a solicited report based on the information received by Pfizer (Mfr Report# UNT-2021-005860)... Read more
Close
This is a solicited report based on the information received by Pfizer (Mfr Report# UNT-2021-005860). A contactable consumer (patient) reported a 57-year-old male received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, Lot Number and Expiration Date unknown) via an unspecified route of administration on 24Feb2021 as age of 57 years old at 1ST DOSE, SINGLE for COVID-19 immunization. Co-suspect medications included: nifedipine via an unspecified route of administration from an unknown date at an unspecified dose, frequency and for hypertension; methylprednisolone (MEDROL, Tablet) orally from an unknown date at 16mg daily and for lupus; treprostinil diethanolamine (ORENITRAM, Extended release tablet) orally (PO) from 01Aug2019 at unknow dose and frequency; orally from unknown date at 3.875mg, every eight hours (q8h);(Lot: 2101647 and Expiration date:30Jan2022) at 0.25mg unknown frequency; (Lot: 2101648 and Expiration date: 31Jan2022) orally from unknown date at unknow dose and frequency; (Lot: 2101649 and Expiration date: 31Jan2022) orally from unknown date at 2.875mg, 3x/day; (Lot: 2101810 and Expiration date: 31Jan2023) orally from unknown date at 0.125 mg unknown frequency;(Lot: 2101646 and Expiration date: 31Jan2022) orally from unknown date at unknown dose and frequency; orally from unknown date and ongoing at 3mg 3x/day; all for primary pulmonary arterial hypertension. Relevant ongoing medical history included primary pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH/ High BP disorder/ increased pressure of pulmonary circulation), calcium deficiency, systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) on Continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP), hypercalcemia, chronically high peripheral artery disease (PAD), hypertension and multifactorial stable SOB (shortness of breath). Patient's family history included: COVID-19 (brother positive). Concomitant medications included ambrisentan (LETAIRIS), spironolactone (ALDACTONE), calcium citrate, ergocalciferol (CITRACAL + D), apixaban (ELIQUIS), epinephrine (EPIPEN), folic acid (FOLVITE), digoxin (LANOXIN), furosemide (LASIX), escitalopram oxalate (LEXAPRO), famotidine (PEPCID), hydroxychloroquine sulfate (PLAQUENIL), and sildenafil citrate (REVATIO). This is a solicited report received on 31Mar2021 from a consumer via (pharmacy name). Patient began therapy with Orenitram (treprostinil diethanolamine), on 01 Aug 2019 for primary pulmonary arterial hypertension. The patient was supplied with Orenitram 0.25mg, 1mg, 2.5mg and 0.125mg and the current dose was reported as 3.875mg, via oral (PO) route, every eight hours (q8h). On 23Mar2021, the patient experienced event COVID-19 and pneumonia (COVID-19 pneumonia, hospitalization, medically significant).On 23Mar2021, 1 year 7 months 23 days after initiating PO Orenitram, the patient was hospitalized due to COVID-19 and pneumonia and discharged on 29 Mar 2021. The patient was on oxygen at the time of reporting. Action taken with PO Orenitram dose for the event of COVID-19 pneumonia was not reported. At the time of reporting, the outcome of the event of COVID-19 pneumonia was unknown.The reporter did not provide causality for the event of COVID-19 pneumonia. Follow-up information was received as solicited report on 15Apr2021 from a consumer via (pharmacy name). On 06Apr2021, the patient had pneumonia (pneumonia, medically significant and hospitalized). Additional lot number and expiration date were added to 2.5 mg concentration of PO Orenitram. On 06Apr2021, 1 year 8 months 6 days after initiating PO Orenitram, the patient was hospitalized due to pneumonia and remained hospitalized at the time of reporting. The patient was also hospitalized in Mar2021 for COVID (previously reported COVID-19 pneumonia). Action taken with PO Orenitram dose for the event of pneumonia was not reported. At the time of reporting, the outcome of the event of pneumonia was unknown. The reporter did not provide causality for the event of pneumonia. Additional spontaneous information was received on 19Apr2021 from a consumer (social worker) via (pharmacy name). Event of pneumonia was omitted and subsumed under COVID-19 pneumonia. Since 06Apr2021, the patient remained hospitalized due to COVID (previously reported COVID-19 pneumonia). Follow-up information was received on 27Apr2021, from a nurse on behalf of the reporting physician via a query response. On 16Apr2021, the patient had acute hypoxemic respiratory failure (AHRF) from COVID, AHRF secondary to Influenza B exacerbating PAH (pulmonary arterial hypertension), AHRF secondary to Flu B and PAH with baseline PAH (acute respiratory failure, hospitalized, medically significant), pulmonary hypertension (pHTN) exacerbation, AHRF (acute hypoxemic respiratory failure) secondary to influenza B exacerbating PAH, pHTN treated with steroids as though to be flare due to lupus (pulmonary arterial hypertension, hospitalized and medically significant), AHRF secondary to Flu B and PAH with baseline PAH (influenza, hospitalized), volume overload (fluid overload, hospitalized). On an unreported date in 2021, the patient had fever, temperature 101.1 F (pyrexia). On an unreported date, the patient had worsening MR (mitral regurgitation) (mitral valve incompetence, medically significant), steroid induced diabetes (steroid diabetes, medically significant), lower extremity edema, 2+ pitting edema, to knees 1+ dependent edema at thighs (oedema peripheral), weight slowly coming down, weight up 4 lbs (weight fluctuation), rash (rash), diarrhea (diarrhoea), and leg healing (limb discomfort). On 16Apr2021, 1 year 8 months 16 days after initiating PO Orenitram, the patient was hospitalised due to acute hypoxemic respiratory failure (AHRF) from COVID (previously reported COVID-19 pneumonia) and for AHRF secondary to influenza B exacerbating PAH, then transferred to the other hospital with volume overload and diuresis. The patient was presented with volume overload and needed oxygen requirement (none needed at home prior to both hospitalizations). The patient's breathing and oxygen were improved with diuresis. Patient's pulmonary hypertension was treated with steroids as though to be flare due to lupus. Patient was given intravenous (IV) solumedrol (25 mg in AM and 16 mg in PM) as per the discussion with rheumatology and pulmonary hypertension cardiology with improvement in oxygen status. On 24Apr2021, the patient relevant diagnostic and laboratory test included: complete blood count (CBC) WBC (white blood count) 4.79, RBC (Red blood cell count) 3.31, Hgb (hemoglobin) 8.4, Plt (Platelet count) 146. Comprehensive metabolic panel (CMP) Na (sodium) 141, K (potassium) 4.1, Blood urea nitrogen (BUN) 39, Creatinine 1.68, glucose 90. On 25Apr2021, the patient had relevant diagnostic and laboratory test included WBC 5.51, RBC 3.24, Hgb 8.2, Plt 159. Na 141, K 4.4, BUN 39, Creatinine 1.59, glucose 117. On 26Apr2021, the patient had relevant diagnostic and laboratory test included WBC 5.41, RBC 3.30, hgb 8.3, Plt 159. Na 141, K 4.4, BUN 37, creatinine 1.54, and glucose 90. The patient was discharged on 26Apr2021. Patient's physical exam at the time of discharge showed pulse 65 bpm, respiratory rate 18 per minute, blood pressure (BP) 138/78 mmHg, temperature 36.5 °C and weight was 90.9 kg. The patient was breathing comfortably in no distress on 2 Litre nasal cannula (NC). Minimal crackles appreciated in the morning posteriorly. The patient had 2+ pitting edema, to knees 1+ dependent edema at thighs and edema unchanged but overall leg size decreased. Continues to be pitting but improved on the day of discharge. Patient's discharge diagnosis pulmonary hypertension exacerbation. Patient's diuretics were increased from 40 mg daily to 60 mg daily and may needed more diuretics. Discharge medications included: Protonix (pantoprazole), Demadex (torsemide), Medrol (methylprednisolone), Citracal + d (calcium citrate, ergocalciferol), Lanoxin (digoxin), Epipen (epinephrine), Lexapro (escitalopram oxalate), Folvite (folic acid), Plaquenil (hydroxychloroquine sulfate). Patient's medications of Pepcid, Lasix, and Aldactone were stopped after discharge from the hospital. The patient was instructed to take pantoprazole 40 mg daily while on steroids and when steroids tapered, he had to discontinue it in future and would stop pantoprazole and resume taking home dose of famotidine. Patient was on nifedipine at home and physician thought to be the contributing factor to lower extremity edema so stopped taking the nifedipine in house. It was reported that steroid induced the diabetes. It was reported that the patient needs transesophageal echocardiogram (TEE) due to had worsening MR (mitral regurgitation) but not agreeable at that time. The patient tried ethacrynic acid 50 mg daily but felt it was not making a difference with his weight. The patient went back on the Bumex (bumetanide) on Friday. Patient's weight slowly coming down to see doing good later on Bumex, his rash subsiding and leg was healing. Patient's weight was stable at 155 lbs and had multifactorial stable shortness of breath (SOB). Patient's weight was above baseline and needed more diuretics. Patient had been in touch with his COVID positive brother who was symptomatic and refused to be covid testing quarantining at that time. On 24Feb2021, the patient got his first dose of COVID-19 vaccine and his temperature was 101.1 °F in 2021. The patient would take Tylenol (paracetamol) and monitor if fever persists to 48 hours he would go to the urgent care. Patient was started on Eliquis and felt much better and no longer to had temperatures and diarrhea. On an 21Apr2021, the patient had right heart catheterization which revealed moderate pulmonary hypertension with right atrium (RA) 7, right ventricle (RV) 12, pressure wave (PW) 15, PA 62/ 25/40, PA saturation 63 %, CO 7, CI 3.52. Patient had chronically high PAD's and could not take metolazone secondary to hypercalcemia and pending admission for colonoscopy with the physician. Patient reminded multiple times by physician for getting a COVID-19 swab. The patient also had increased 4 lb weight in Apr 2021 since discharge from the hospital. Action taken with PO Orenitram dose due to the event of COVID-19 pneumonia was updated to dose decreased and for the events of acute respiratory failure, pulmonary arterial hypertension, influenza, fluid overload, mitral valve incompetence, steroid diabetes, oedema peripheral, weight fluctuation, rash, pyrexia, diarrhoea and limb discomfort was not reported. Action taken with nifedipine, and Medrol dose for the events of COVID-19 pneumonia, acute respiratory failure, pulmonary arterial hypertension, influenza, fluid overload, mitral valve incompetence, steroid diabetes, oedema peripheral, weight fluctuation, rash, pyrexia diarrhoea and limb discomfort was not reported. At the time of reporting, the outcome of the events of acute respiratory failure, pulmonary arterial hypertension, influenza, fluid overload, mitral valve incompetence, steroid diabetes, oedema peripheral, weight fluctuation was unknown. The outcome of the events of rash and limb discomfort was recovering. The outcome of the events of pyrexia and diarrhoea was recovered on an unreported date in 2021. The reporter did not provide causality for the events of acute respiratory failure, pulmonary arterial hypertension, influenza, fluid overload, mitral valve incompetence, steroid diabetes, oedema peripheral, weight fluctuation, rash, pyrexia, diarrhoea, and limb discomfort. Case Comment/Senders Comment: The company has assessed the serious adverse events of COVID-19 pneumonia, acute respiratory failure, pulmonary arterial hypertension, influenza, fluid overload, mitral valve incompetence, and steroid diabetes as not related to Orenitram. The event of COVID-19 pneumonia was related to the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 pandemic, and the event influenza was related to seasonal Influenza B. The event acute respiratory failure was likely related to acute influenza, but was also possibly impacted by pulmonary insult from COVID-19 pneumonia, and underlying lupus associated with PAH. The event pulmonary arterial hypertension was likely an exacerbation of the underlying PAH due to the concurrent infections. The event mitral valve incompetence and fluid overload were likely related to cardiac dysfunction associated with the underlying chronic and progressive PAH. The event steroid diabetes was likely related to co-suspect medication Medrol, which was used as treatment for the lupus, although co-suspect medication nifedipine was possibly contributory to the event in view of its safety profile and as such cannot be excluded. Pfizer is a marketing authorization holder of [Nifedipine] in the country of incidence or the country where the product was purchased (if different). This may be a duplicate report if another marketing authorization holder of [Nifedipine] has submitted the same report to the regulatory authorities. Information on the batch/Lot number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on the temporal association and the known safety profile, a possible contributory role of BNT162B2 to the development of drug ineffective, COVID-19, pneumonia, rash, pyrexia and diarrhoea cannot be excluded. Acute hypoxemic respiratory failure was secondary to COVID-19, therefore was also considered as related to BNT162B2. The other events were considered as due to underlying or intercurrent conditions and unrelated to BNT162B2. Steroid diabetes was considered as related to methylprednisolone and other events were unrelated to methylprednisolone. Oedema peripheral and limb discomfort were considered as related to nifedipine and other events were unrelated to nifedipine. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.
